Secondary Weapons.description: Many decades ago, Kraz Cybernetics started a project to upgrade the ancient Gatling Gun design with newer designing technics. While they actually could increase its accuracy and make it maintain substained fire for a longer time, their weapon, the so-called Accurate Gatling Blaster, also requires more energy and more time to completely cool down, not to mention the higher cost and the bullets capacity reduced to little more than half.
Secondary Weapons.name: Accurate Gatling Blaster

Secondary Weapons.description: Phaser.
Secondary Weapons.name: Phased Disruption Laser

Secondary Weapons.description: Phaser Turret.
Secondary Weapons.name: Phased Disruption Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: Dispersal Launcher.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dispersal Rocket Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Pursuit Launcher.
Secondary Weapons.name: Pursuit Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: SAD Deployer.
Secondary Weapons.name: SAD Deployer

Secondary Weapons.description: SAE Deployer.
Secondary Weapons.name: SAE Deployer

Secondary Weapons.description: Mirau Pod Deployer.
Secondary Weapons.name: Mirau Pod Deployer

Secondary Weapons.description: Siphoner.
Secondary Weapons.name: Plasma Siphoner

Secondary Weapons.description: Beamer Turret.
Secondary Weapons.name: Igadzra Disruption Beamer

Secondary Weapons.description:
This strange weapon comprises of a heat conduit that runs throughout the entire ship, channeling all of the ship's excess heat directly into this gun. Upon firing, all the heat is forced into the firing chamber using an inordinately strong heat pump, resulting in a thermally ionized plasma that is compressed into bolts and then discharged, dumping all of the heat from the Casparna's internals onto the first target it hits. The temperatures achieved by the projectiles are so hot that it can cause metals such as titanium to melt as if they were butter, and the heat can even cause premature burnoff in an enemy ship's fuel tanks.

The downside of relying on the ship's heat systems to power the main cannon is that, if the ship is too cold, the gun will fail to fire, and this system also doubles as the primary heat expulsion method of the ship.
Secondary Weapons.name: Thermobore Cannon

Secondary Weapons.description: This fabricator produces pyrophoric warheads and launches them quite quickly, delivering reliable area damage at a moderate range while without compromising too much on fire rate. The molotovs, though quick and easy to produce, are quite fragile, however, and will break under even moderate anti-missile fire.
Secondary Weapons.name: Molotov Fabricator

Secondary Weapons.description:
This is a Hwacha-style weapon that attempts to dump as much of its ammo as it can all at once. The result is a shotgun-like effect, showing the area in rather slow but persistent unguided missiles.

Because the weapon dumps a hundred projectiles on a target all at once, it takes a significant amount of time to reload.
Secondary Weapons.name: Hwacha Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: This is a colossal variant of the flamethrower, able to project gouts of flame across massive distances. In contrast to the classic human flamethrower, the Nova Turrt has integrated ramscooping and fuel storage equipment, likely to offset its enormous fuel needs.
Secondary Weapons.name: Nova Turret

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Induction Missile Launcher is one of the most powerful guns the Quaernan has, capable of rapidly firing a stream of fast, accurate, powerful missiles. It works in tandem with the numerous Marker Turrets on the Quaernan: their heat damage increases the likelihood an Induction Missile will retain a lock.

Like the Beehive Cannon, the ship has all of the necessary internal machinery to manufacture the requisite missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: Induction Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
At first glance, the Beehive Cannon might seem a little worthless, as it has no method of producing its own ammunition. You then go deeper into the Quaernan and find an entire assembly line for creating Beehive Munitions perfectly integrated into the ship, ready for operation. You need to dedicate crew to ammunition hauling, but otherwise, it's as easy as buying materials and letting the ship do its thing.

The Beehive Munitions themselves are quite imposing; a thick shell that bursts into dozens of smaller units upon nearing a target. Considering the Quaernan's defenses, you can't help but wonder if they were designed explicitly to counter this weapon.
Secondary Weapons.name: Beehive Cannon

Secondary Weapons.description:
Though the Rift Tearer is undoubtedly the main gun of the Quaernan, there's something unsettlingly final about this enormous missile rig. The launcher itself is large, albeit unimpressive; the only standout aspect of the launcher is the fact that, upon firing, the launcher imparts a fair portion of your ship's shield into the projectile, making it extremely hard to destroy.

What most stands out to you, however, is the enormous production machine, designed to use unimaginable amounts of power to create and consolidate antimatter into a very real, very usable form. Out of sheer respect for (and fear of) the technology, you opt to set as many overseers as possible to the task of operation.
Secondary Weapons.name: Antimatter Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
This is a far smaller implementation of the Beehive Cannon, able to be run successfully on a ship the size of a Llama, or theoretically even an Alpaca. Though its munitions are weaker and deliver less of a payload, they are far faster and nimbler, allowing them to close the great distances they often travel with ease.

Of course, it still takes a considerable amount of time to create the projectiles, especially with the smaller-scale operation, so the fire rate is a bit lower.
Secondary Weapons.name: Beehive Gun

Secondary Weapons.description:
A deadly scattershot weapon that excels in crushing groups of enemies, while anything hit by the main pulse is quickly shattered by the immense energies.

When the Mil'taj first came to this galaxy, these weapons were what they used in their initial battles with the Quarg. While unbelievably powerful, now that contact with their home systems is cut off and they are unable to replicate them these are considered their most prized outfits.
Secondary Weapons.name: Matter Shredder

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Plasma Howitzer is an experimental augmentation of the Plasma Cannon that uses strong magnets to bind together an oversized plasma projectile, before stuffing the projectile with a bit of hyperspace fuel and launching it. These projectiles are highly unstable, to the point where even a bare graze is enough to release the plasma explosion.

	To keep the magnets cooled enough to function, the weapon must directly tap from the ship's normal cooling systems.
Secondary Weapons.name: Plasma Howitzer

Secondary Weapons.description:
This is a low-powered pneumatic launcher that sends six-ton reactor rods out into space. The resulting projectile moves slowly and has no sort of homing or proximity detonation, but if it hits its target, the subsequent explosion can cripple an entire fleet of small warships.

	Using uranium reactor rods in this way, however, is a criminal offense, so a hefty fine awaits any captain intending on making heavy use of these improvised weapons.
Secondary Weapons.name: Reactor Rod Cannon

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Unfettered have made a point of tweaking and improving Hai technology for their own uses, and this weapon is a good example of this strategy. Essentially an ionic grenade launcher, this weapon fires Charge Gas canisters that are under high pressure, making them likely to explode long before they reach their target. By re-engineering the Charge Gas Sprayer into a smaller weapon and cutting out an integrated storage tank, the Unfettered have created a potent fighter weapon out of a system typically reserved for larger ships.

	Though not a significant factor in the weapon's effectiveness, the frangible canisters fired deal minor damage to the target, making this weapon significantly more effective against hull.
Secondary Weapons.name: Charge Gas Grenadier

Secondary Weapons.description:
The compact and greater-ranged nature of the Charge Gas Grenadier means it is a suitable candidate for being mounted aboard turrets. The Charge Barrage turret fires tight bursts of eight Charge Gas grenades in rapid succession, bombarding the target with ionic gas and shrapnel, before a somewhat lengthy reload period.

	To make better use of the larger size of turret-wielding ships, the turret includes an auxiliary gas tank.
Secondary Weapons.name: Charge Barrage Turret

Secondary Weapons.description:
Charge Gas was developed by the Hai during their war with the Korath as an inexpensive way to force Korath raiding ships into unfavourable combat conditions. The basic principle is simple: an easily producible, stable gas that holds an ionizing charge for long periods of time, deployed in broad sweeps to inhibit enemy movement. When dispensed from a fast-moving platform like a Lightning Bug, it becomes a very effective crowd-control tool.

	The Charge Gas storage, containment, and deployment network has some curious properties as well. In particular, stored charge gas can act as a reserve ion sink; a small amount of gas can't noticeably dissipate much, but a full tank will quickly absorb any ionization affecting a ship. Additionally, if not allowed to spread out and set properly, the Charge Gas won't be as effective against enemies.
Secondary Weapons.name: Charge Gas Sprayer

Secondary Weapons.description:
Though Coalition civilians are not normally allowed to purchase explosives of any kind, Celebration Modules exist in a legal limbo, as they are considered a form of artistic expression and thus are allowed to be sold in regulated venues.

	As fireworks, Celebration Modules produce bright flashes and vibrant swathes of colour; though the Heliarchy has taken every precaution to reduce their potential danger, the fact remains that they still do spread fire in all directions, and the bright flash can cause issues with weapon targeting.

	To reduce potential complications with starlets colliding with ships, the rockets contain a small proximity sensor that forces them to explode a distance away from potential victims.
Secondary Weapons.name: Small Celebration Module

Secondary Weapons.description:
Celebration Modules have long since become associated with the Coalition's great sporting events; trained Heliarch fightercraft engage in "spectral dogfights," where the bright swathes of colour put on a great spectacle for the crowds during the downtime between athletic competitions.

	To reduce potential complications with starlets colliding with ships, the rockets contain a small proximity sensor that forces them to explode a distance away from potential victims.
Secondary Weapons.name: Medium Celebration Module

Secondary Weapons.description:
Celebration Modules have a very long and rich past in the Heliarch legal system - so much so that, in many of the languages of the Coalition, these devices have taken on an alternative name invariably meaning "contraband." To this day, it still remains debated if civilians should be permitted to purchase them, but for now it seems the citizens of the Coalition are permitted to enjoy them (responsibly, of course).

	To reduce potential complications with starlets colliding with ships, the rockets contain a small proximity sensor that forces them to explode a distance away from potential victims.
Secondary Weapons.name: Large Celebration Module

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Gegno Scin have tried a number of different ways to accelerate the deployment of their plasma-based weaponry. Praeparit Punts utilize pre-charged capacitors to supplant a ship's on-board generation. While this requires an initial spark of on-board electricity to function, the overall operation results in a small amount of energy being returned to the ship.

	The excess in energy tends to overwhelm the Scin's lower-power plasma coils, so the resultant blast of plasma pellets suffers from highly variable range and velocity.
Secondary Weapons.name: Praeparit Punt

Secondary Weapons.description:
When the Korath first salvaged a ship equipped with Gatling Guns, they were astonished at its potency. Originally more interested in its scrap value than anything else, the Exiles ignored the Gatling Gun on their raids until, in an uncommonly perilous fight against human pirates, the weapon was shown to be able to deal remarkable damage - especially to a ship with downed shields.

	The Korath's reimagining of the Gatling Gun benefits greatly from the inclusion of their technology: improved electronics and a redesigned motor doubles the weapon's fire rate, and integrated cooling loops reduce the need for an extensive cooldown period. Though the ammunition stores burn down much faster than a human Gatling gun, the weapon still remains extremely effective.

	While the weapon's cooldown period is staunchly reduced due to the cooling loop, it still eventually dumps all of its heat back into the parent ship.
Secondary Weapons.name: Korath Vulcan

Secondary Weapons.description: Developed with Kor Sestor fighters in mind, the Piercer Pod is a smaller implementation of the Piercer Launcher found on Kor Sestor warships. While its fire rate isn't the greatest, when paired with a carrier with particularly large Piercer reserves, fighters equipped with these pods are able to deal considerable damage for extended periods of time.
Secondary Weapons.name: Piercer Missile Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Faster type of torpedo developed by MJK for use in newer warships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Type-83 Yoden Torpedo Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Modified Typhoon with much of its fuel and navigation system removed leaving it a mostly a dumb bomb with minimal course correction in exchange for tougher shell, more payload, and deadlier explosions.
Secondary Weapons.name: MH-4 Typhoon Bomb Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A missile system manufactured by CCS Corp. based on a far older missile system. It's main advantage is being cheaper and smaller than Sidewinder but with better tracking and homing capability than Meteor. It also have the benefit of being easier to find ammunition source as the CCS made deals to multiple outfitter around the space to ensure availability of its missile.
Secondary Weapons.name: Feiyu Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Turret version of the CCS Corp. Feiyu missile launcher.
Secondary Weapons.name: Feiyu Missile Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: Tough, slow missile that will increase burn (and vulnerability) when close to target.
Secondary Weapons.name: Swordfish Missile Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: A smart missile that can dodge obstacles and untargeted ships to ensure it hit the correct target.
Secondary Weapons.name: Mjolnir Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Powerful anti-ship missile
Secondary Weapons.name: Spearfish VLS Array

Secondary Weapons.description: Powerful anti-ship missile
Secondary Weapons.name: Spearfish Launcher Array

Secondary Weapons.description: Powerful anti-ship missile with very limited maneuvrability but can guide itself around obstacles.
Secondary Weapons.name: AH-5 Eteron Launch System

Secondary Weapons.description:
Large bomb concealed as a cargo box.

	[Box missiles are a one-shot weapon: each missile occupies a gun slot, and after it is fired, the slot it was in is left empty.]
Secondary Weapons.name: QB-10 Box Missile

Secondary Weapons.description: An ancient "storm missile" once used by NGK Q-Ships to suddenly overwhelm attackers.
Secondary Weapons.name: NjHc-S-5 Arashi SMLS

Secondary Weapons.description: A relic missile system designed for planetary bombardment back in the first turf war. It was also deployed against Alphas several times during the Alpha War and were locked away shortly after the war. The Chiryu Missile is used exclusively by NGK Security fleets.
Secondary Weapons.name: Chiryu Launch System

Secondary Weapons.description: Itano Saturation Missile Launch System is as much of a development in missile as well as a change in deployment tactic. Unlike common missiles that were slowly deployed one-by-one, this system fire missiles in pairs and in very rapid succession to totally overwhelm any anti-missile system and ensure the destruction whatever is unfortunate enough to be its target.
Secondary Weapons.name: Itano SMLS

Secondary Weapons.description: Smaller version of the Itano SMLS for installing on ships with limited space.
Secondary Weapons.name: Itano SMLS Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Turreted version of the Hai Railgun for ships with some left over space and a turret mount free.
Secondary Weapons.name: MYi2 Railgun Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: The Mass Driver uses a shot of hyperdrive fuel and a substantial spark to begin IBS acceleration, which then continues through a series of superconducting helical electromagnets to muzzle velocity. Ships caught at point-blank range are treated to overheated systems and a significant push from the hyper-accelerated combusting hyperdrive fuel muzzle flareand then the fully intact IBS. The weapon mostly shields the hull from damaging quantum flux, but as a side effect, acts like it's far more massive when installed on a ship. Make no mistake: this is long range support artillery, and ships carrying many of this weapon will require escort support.
Secondary Weapons.name: Mass Driver

Secondary Weapons.description: The Sheragi Kinetic Spear Launcher is a weapon designed to rip through the hulls of ships. The weapon fires a large unguided tungsten rod which completely penetrates shields. The fact it is made of solid metal makes this weapon very difficult to shoot down with standard Anti-Missile systems.
Secondary Weapons.name: Kinetic Spear Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: The missiles this launches are not as good at tracking and don't do splash damage the way the Rukjay missiles do, but some captains regard the nonexistence of heat creation as worth it for the less powerful defenses.
Secondary Weapons.name: Ruksay Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: The missiles this launches have great tracking and do some splash damage at the cost of generating some heat. Most Jibauni captains regard the tracking as good enough to more than make up for the heat inefficiency.
Secondary Weapons.name: Rukjay Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: The M61 Vulcan was a gatling cannon that was quite widespread back in the 21st century. It was used in everything from fighter jets, to ground vehicles and naval units. It has been modified and upgraded to serve humanity once more.
Secondary Weapons.name: M61 Vulcan

Secondary Weapons.description: The M39 was an autocannon that was used by some aircraft in the 20th century. It has been upgraded to serve humanity once more.
Secondary Weapons.name: M39 Autocannon

Secondary Weapons.description: Dual mounted 20mm autocannon turrets.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dual 20mm Autocannon Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: A turret with a M61 Gatling Cannon and electronic systems to be used as an anti fighter weapon.
Secondary Weapons.name: Vulcan Air Defense System

Secondary Weapons.description: A gatling cannon firing 30x173mm.
Secondary Weapons.name: Gau-8 Avenger

Secondary Weapons.description: An autocannon firing 30x173mm.
Secondary Weapons.name: Mk44 Bushmaster II Autocannon

Secondary Weapons.description: A cannon that was used in some 21st century naval warships, it has been upgraded to serve once more.
Secondary Weapons.name: 76mm OTO Melara Turret

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-1w is based on a missile called the AIM-9 Sidewinder. This missile used to serve a bunch of countries and weapon systems in the 21st century. It has been modified and upgraded to serve once more.

This is a pod for fighters to launch AIM-1w missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: AIM-1w Sidewinder Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-1w is based on a missile called the AIM-9 Sidewinder. This missile used to serve a bunch of countries and weapon systems in the 21st century. It has been modified and upgraded to serve once more.

This a revolving launcher used for larger ships to launch AIM-1w missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: AIM-1w Sidewinder Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-3w is based on a 21st century missile called the AIM-120 AMRAAM. It is a medium range BVR missile. It has been modified and upgraded to serve humanity once more.

This is a pod made to fire AIM-3w missiles from fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: AIM-3w AMRAAM Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-3w is based on a 21st century missile called the AIM-120 AMRAAM. It is a medium range BVR missile. It has been modified and upgraded to serve humanity once more.

This a revolving launcher used for larger ships to launch AIM-3w missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: AIM-3w AMRAAM Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
An unguided rocket usually used to attack ground targets, although it can technically be used as both anti fighter and anti capital roles.

This is a MLRS version. While it has short range, it can launch a lot of rockets in a short period.
Secondary Weapons.name: Hydra 70w MLRS

Secondary Weapons.description:
An unguided rocket usually used to attack ground targets, although it can technically be used as both anti fighter and anti capital roles.

Pod for firing Hydra 70s rockets.
Secondary Weapons.name: Hydra 70w Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
A napalm bomb. Very useful to overheat enemy ships.

A pod for launching SMB-1 bombs.
Secondary Weapons.name: SMB-1w Scorcher Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
A bomb usually used to attack bunkers and armored targets that can also be used for attacking capital ships.

A pod for launching GBU-1s bombs.
Secondary Weapons.name: GBU-1w Piercer Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
A supersonic unguided torpedo built to devastate enemy capital ships.

This is a pod for firing UGT-1w torpedos.
Secondary Weapons.name: UGT-1w Shadow Strike Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
A supersonic unguided torpedo built to devastate enemy capital ships.

This is a launch rack to fire one single UGT-1w torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: UGT-1w Shadow Strike Launch Rack

Secondary Weapons.description:
The UnGuided Torpedo 1x is a supersonic unguided torpedo that is made to destroy enemy capital ships.

This is a revolving launcher system that fires the UGT-1x Torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: UGT-1w Shadow strike Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AGM-4x is based on the AGM-158 LRASM. This was a missile originally made in the 21st century to attack naval ships. It has been modernized and reworked to serve once more.

Pod for launching LRASM anti ship missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: AGM-4w LRASM Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A super railgun that can only be mounted on a special mount. It features a revolver like system to allow multiple rounds to be stored in one gun. There are six rounds in the revolver system and a further 12 rounds are stored in a special storage room.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dragonfire Super Railgun

Secondary Weapons.description: Using the same cartridge as the M61, it is more compact but has a slower firing rate. It does however benefit from having more accuracy and slightly higher range. (Special thanks to 1010todd for letting me use the artwork from the 50 cal mod)
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion M39 Autocannon

Secondary Weapons.description: This is a gun originally used in a lot of our atmospheric fighters. It uses 20mm rounds. It is now available for you to put on your ships. Due to our advanced fabrication systems, it uses fuel instead of ammo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion M61 Vulcan

Secondary Weapons.description: Using the same cartridge as the Gau 12, it is more compact but has a slower firing rate. It does however benefit from having more accuracy and slightly higher range. (Special thanks to 1010todd for letting me use the artwork from the 50 cal mod)
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion M242 Bushmaster Autocannon

Secondary Weapons.description: This is a gun originally used in our AV-8 Harriers and F-35 atmospheric fighters. It uses 25mm rounds. It is now available for you to put on your ships. Due to our advanced fabrication systems, it uses fuel instead of ammo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Gau-12 Equalizer

Secondary Weapons.description: Using the same cartridge as the GAU 8, it is more compact but has a slower firing rate. It does however benefit from having more accuracy and slightly higher range. (Special thanks to 1010todd for letting me use the artwork from the 50 cal mod)
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Mk44 Bushmaster II Autocannon

Secondary Weapons.description: This is a gun originally used in our A-10 atmospheric fighter. It uses 30mm rounds. Due to our advanced fabrication systems, it uses energy instead of ammo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Gau-8 Avenger

Secondary Weapons.description: The Electro Magnetic Auto Cannon is a weapon designed to improve fighter and drone survivability by allowing them to remain outside of enemy weapon range.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion EMAC

Secondary Weapons.description: The Gauss Assisted Gatling gun is a weapon designed to improve fighter and drone survivability by allowing them to remain outside of enemy weapon range.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion EMAG

Secondary Weapons.description: A pulse laser used by some of Arion's more advanced fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Pulse Laser

Secondary Weapons.description:
The ElectroMagnetic Launcher is a hybrid conventional cannon mixed with a railgun, allowing this thing to pierce through enemies and cause massive damage.

This is a smaller compact version made to fit in smaller ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion E.M.L Compact

Secondary Weapons.description:
The ElectroMagnetic Launcher is a hybrid conventional cannon mixed with a railgun, allowing this thing to pierce through enemies and cause massive damage.

This is a smaller turreted version made to fit in smaller ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion E.M.L Turret Compact

Secondary Weapons.description:
The ElectroMagnetic Launcher is a hybrid conventional cannon mixed with a railgun, allowing this thing to pierce through enemies and cause massive damage.

This is a turreted version.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion E.M.L

Secondary Weapons.description: The ElectroMagnetic Launcher is a hybrid conventional cannon mixed with a railgun, allowing this thing to pierce through enemies and cause massive damage.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion E.M.L Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: When the RnD department received reports of Arion ships unable to combat swarms of enemy fighters, they immediately set out to create a special anti fighter turret. The result is an EML turret that fires airburst munitions to clear out enemy fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Anti Fighter E.M.L Turret Compact

Secondary Weapons.description: The AIM-1x Super Sidewinder is a general purpose missile that can be used to attack all types of enemies, including ground, naval and air. It is also very useful on spacecraft due to it being a credible threat to both Capital Ships and Fighters. This version uses fabricators instead of the 'pocket dimension' to prepare missiles to be fired.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-1x Sidewinder Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-1x Super Sidewinder is a general purpose missile that can be used to attack all types of enemies, including ground, naval and air. It is also very useful on spacecraft due to it being a credible threat to both Capital Ships and Fighters. This version uses fabricators instead of the 'pocket dimension' to prepare missiles to be fired.

This launcher uses a revolver system allowing larger ships to fire more missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-1x Sidewinder Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-1x Super Sidewinder is a general purpose missile that can be used to attack all types of enemies, including ground, naval and air. It is also very useful on spacecraft due to it being a credible threat to both Capital Ships and Fighters. This version uses fabricators instead of the 'pocket dimension' to prepare missiles to be fired.

This is a turreted MLRS version.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-1x Sidewinder M.L.M.S

Secondary Weapons.description: The AIM-2x Super Sparrow is a medium range air to air missile that can be used against ground targets in an emergency. It has more explosive than the AMRAAM but less range.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-2x Sparrow Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The AIM-3x Super AMRAAM is a long range mainly anti air missile, although it can be used against ground targets in an emergency. Much like the sidewinder, this missile can also be found on all of the branches of our military.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-3x AMRAAM Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-3x Super AMRAAM is a long range mainly anti air missile, although it can be used against ground targets in an emergency. Much like the sidewinder, this missile can also be found on all of the branches of our military.

This launcher uses a revolver system allowing larger ships to fire more missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-3x AMRAAM Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-3x Super AMRAAM is a long range mainly anti air missile, although it can be used against ground targets in an emergency. Much like the sidewinder, this missile can also be found on all of the branches of our military.

This is a turreted MLRS version.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-3x AMRAAM M.L.M.S

Secondary Weapons.description: The AIM-4x Super Phoenix is a super long range heavy a2a missile mainly designed to shoot down bombers.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-4x Phoenix Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The Super Hydra 70x is used by attack aircraft and attack helicopters to launch multiple rockets at ground targets. In space, it is mainly used against larger warships but a skilled pilot can use it to hit other fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Hydra 70x Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Super Hydra 70x is used by attack aircraft and attack helicopters to launch multiple rockets at ground targets. In space, it is mainly used against larger warships but a skilled pilot can use it to hit other fighters.

This is a MLRS version. While it has short range, it can launch a lot of rockets in a short period.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Hydra 70x MLRS

Secondary Weapons.description: Napalm bomb mainly used to clear sections of forest and destroy bio threats. Can also be used to overheat ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion SMB-1x Scorcher Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GBU-1x Piercer Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The AGM-2x Maverick is an air to ground missile, meaning that it is made to strike specifically at ground targets.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-2x Maverick Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Even though it is classified as a air to ground missile, this is a bit of a misnomer as it is actually a guided gliding bomb. It is used to allow our aircraft to safely launch bombs from beyond enemy air defense.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-3x JSOW Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The AGM-4x LRASM is a cruise missile that is used by Arion and its allies for multiple roles. It can be carried by certain land based artillery systems, air launched aircraft systems and naval systems.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-4x LRASM Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The UnGuided Torpedo 1x is a supersonic unguided torpedo that is made to destroy enemy capital ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion UGT-1x Shadow strike Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The UnGuided Torpedo 1x is a supersonic unguided torpedo that is made to destroy enemy capital ships.

This is a revolving launcher system that fires the UGT-1x Torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion UGT-1x Shadow strike Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: The Guided Torpedo Unit-1x Shark is a heavy guided torpedo used to devastate large Capital ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GTU-1x Shark Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Torpedo Unit-1x Shark is a heavy guided torpedo used to devastate large Capital ships.

This is a revolving launcher system that fires the GTU-1x Shark Torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GTU-1x Shark Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: A MIRV that spreads into 10 smaller fragments.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Hurricane MIRV Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: We've noticed there were problems with the E.M.L being overkill, so we made this version to stun enemies instead of destroying them.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion E.M.L Compact (Disabler)

Secondary Weapons.description: The rocket pod is used by attack aircraft to launch multiple rockets at the enemy.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Rocket Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The standard Arion missile is a general purpose missile that can be used both to stun and finish of enemies, although it is not as effective as doing either of those things.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Missile Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The Multiple Launch Missile Pod Large is a larger version of the missile launchers found on our fighters, bombers and such. Due to our advanced fabrication system it uses energy instead of ammo. The missiles are made to destroy shields and stun enemies.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion M.L.M.P.L

Secondary Weapons.description: The Multiple Launch Missile System, we made this system to help destroy incoming threats from a slightly longer distance than the lasers. Due to our advanced fabrication systems, it uses energy instead of ammo. The missiles are made to destroy shields and stun enemies.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion M.L.M.S

Secondary Weapons.description: The Pursuer missile is used to stun and allow attacks on the enemy.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Pursuer Missile Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The Finisher missile is used to finish off enemies that has been stunned or weakened.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Finisher Missile Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Single launch Guided Penetration Bomb for fighter aircraft. Useful for helping destroy Capital ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion G.P.B Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Heavy unguided torpedo made to destroy or disable large warships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Unguided Torpedo Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Heavy guided torpedo made to destroy or disable large warships. This is the pod variant.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Guided Torpedo Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Heavy guided torpedo made to destroy or disable large warships. This is the launcher variant.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Guided Torpedo Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Single launch L.R.A.S.M for fighter aircraft. Useful for helping weaken Capital ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion L.R.A.S.M Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GPB-1x Piercer Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The UnGuided Torpedo-1x is a heavy unguided torpedo used to devastate large Capital ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion UGT-1x Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: While technically its is a missile instead of a rocket, it is functionally similar to an MLRS launcher. This launcher fires the AIM-2x.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-2x AMRAAM M.L.M.S

Secondary Weapons.description: The AMRAAM Launcher is a missile system that uses a revolver system to move missiles into the firing position. It fires the AIM-2x.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-2x AMRAAM Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: The AIM-2x Super AMRAAM (sometimes also nicknamed the SLAMRAAM) is a medium range multipurpose missile, although unlike the sidewinder it is much more suited for air targets. Much like the sidewinder, this missile can also be found on all of the branches of our military, wether it be a SAM battery or mounted on a ship.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-2x AMRAAM Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The bomb bay on the B-52 used for storing guided penetration bombs until needed.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion B52 Bomb Bay Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: The bomb bay on the B-1 used for storing guided penetration bombs until needed.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion B1 Bomb Bay Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: The bomb bay on the B-2 used for storing guided penetration bombs until needed.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion B2 Bomb Bay Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: The bomb bay on the Vulcan used for storing guided penetration bombs until needed.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Vulcan Bomb Bay Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: The bomb bay on the B-52 used for storing nuclear bombs until needed.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion B52 Nuclear Bomb Bay Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: The bomb bay on the B-1 used for storing nuclear bombs until needed.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion B1 Nuclear Bomb Bay Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: The bomb bay on the B-2 used for storing nuclear bombs until needed.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion B2 Nuclear Bomb Bay Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: The bomb bay on the Vulcan used for storing nuclear bombs until needed.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Vulcan Nuclear Bomb Bay Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: A pod for launching AIM-1S missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: AIM-1s Sidewinder Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A pod for launching the AIM-2s AMRAAM.
Secondary Weapons.name: AIM-2s AMRAAM Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Pod for firing Hydra 70s rockets.
Secondary Weapons.name: Hydra 70s Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A pod for launching GPB-1s bombs.
Secondary Weapons.name: GPB-1s Piercer Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A pod for firing UGT-1s torpedos.
Secondary Weapons.name: UGT-1s Stingray Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A launch for firing one UGT-1s torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: UGT-1s Stingray Launch Rack

Secondary Weapons.description: Pod for launching LRASM anti ship missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: LRASM Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A Vertical Launching variant that fires the AIM-1x.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-1x Sidewinder VLS

Secondary Weapons.description: A Vertical Launching variant that fires the AIM-2x.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-2x AMRAAM VLS

Secondary Weapons.description: We made this things to kill 'memes'. Because fuck you that's why. Also due to its sheer power, it will almost kill any ship using it and will destroy the railgun instantly.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Singularity Destroyer Railgun

Secondary Weapons.description:
This is a gun originally used in a lot of our atmospheric fighters. It uses 20mm rounds. It is now available for you to put on your ships. Due to our advanced fabrication systems, it uses fuel instead of ammo.

This is a gunpod version for fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion M61 Vulcan Gunpod

Secondary Weapons.description:
This is a gun originally used in our AV-8 Harriers and F-35 atmospheric fighters. It uses 25mm rounds. It is now available for you to put on your ships. Due to our advanced fabrication systems, it uses fuel instead of ammo.

This is an externally mounted version.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Gau-12 Equalizer Gunpod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-1x Super Sidewinder is a general purpose missile that can be used to attack all types of enemies, including ground, naval and air. It is also very useful on spacecraft due to it being a credible threat to both Capital Ships and Fighters. This version uses fabricators instead of the 'pocket dimension' to prepare missiles to be fired.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter hardpoints.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-1x Sidewinder External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-2x Super Sparrow is a medium range air to air missile that can be used against ground targets in an emergency. It has more explosive than the AMRAAM but less range.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter hardpoints.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-2x Sparrow External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-3x Super AMRAAM is a long range mainly anti air missile, although it can be used against ground targets in an emergency. Much like the sidewinder, this missile can also be found on all of the branches of our military.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter hardpoints.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-3x AMRAAM External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-4x Super Phoenix is a super long range heavy a2a missile mainly designed to shoot down bombers.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter hardpoints.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-4x Phoenix External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Super Hydra 70x is used by attack aircraft and attack helicopters to launch multiple rockets at ground targets. In space, it is mainly used against larger warships but a skilled pilot can use it to hit other fighters.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter racks.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Hydra 70x External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
Napalm bomb mainly used to clear sections of forest and destroy bio threats. Can also be used to overheat ships.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter racks.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion SMB-1x Scorcher External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter racks.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GBU-1x Piercer External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AGM-2x Maverick is an air to ground missile, meaning that it is made to strike specifically at ground targets.

This is a version made to be mounted on external hardpoints.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-2x Maverick External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
Even though it is classified as a air to ground missile, this is a bit of a misnomer as it is actually a guided gliding bomb. It is used to allow our aircraft to safely launch bombs from beyond enemy air defense.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter hardpoints.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-3x JSOW External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AGM-4x LRASM is a cruise missile that is used by Arion and its allies for multiple roles. It can be carried by certain land based artillery systems, air launched aircraft systems and naval systems.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter hardpoints.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-4x LRASM External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The UnGuided Torpedo 1x is a supersonic unguided torpedo that is made to destroy enemy capital ships.

This is a version made to be mounted on fighter hardpoints.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion UGT-1x Shadow strike External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Torpedo Unit-1x Shark is a heavy guided torpedo used to devastate large Capital ships.

This is a externally mounted version.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GTU-1x Shark External Pod

weapon.ammo: Arion B1 Tactical Nuke bomb Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description:
Tactical nuclear bomb used both by strike fighters and bombers. It is smaller than the bombs normally used specially by bombers since it is made to strike high value targets instead of cities.

Tactical nuclear bomb rack for special strike fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Tac Nuke Bomb Rack Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: A laser that fires that fires in bursts of 3 seconds that can destroy a lot of ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Vaporizer T.L.S

Secondary Weapons.description:
Based on a US project to make a plasma railgun, this weapon has been fully completed and is ready to destroy enemies.

This is an enlarged version made to fit in spinal mounts.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion MARAUDER XL Super Railgun

Secondary Weapons.description: A new design, this railgun features a revolver like system which allows the railgun to have significantly faster reloads. Like the dragons breath, it requires a special mount.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Dragonfire Railgun

Secondary Weapons.description: This is a super weapon adapted from our usual ships to be fitted on ships in this universe. Although, it requires a special mount to be fitted on, so only certain ships can be fitted with these. Anything that isn't destroyed should be disabled after a shot, but the energy, heat and reload time should encourage you to only shoot at high priority targets.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Dragonsbreath Railgun

Secondary Weapons.description: Basically the largest railgun that you will have access to. It can kill basically anything, and if it can't kill it in one shot it'll kill it with the next.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Heavenpiercer Railgun

Secondary Weapons.description:
The RIM-3x ERAM is a multi purpose missile that can be used for targeting fighters, ships and ground targets. This specific version can only target aircraft and ships and not missiles for some reason.

One Mk 41 VLS cell can hold 1 RIM-3 missile and this VLS pack has 8 cells. This version fires all the missiles in a burst.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion RIM-3x ERAM VLS

Secondary Weapons.description:
The BGM-1x Tomahawk is a cruise missile that can be used by ships, submarines, land based launcher and even some aircraft. This specific variant has a nuclear warhead.

One Mk 41 VLS cell can hold 1 BGM-1 missile and this VLS pack has 8 cells. This version fires all the missiles in a burst.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion BGM-1x Tomahawk Nuclear VLS

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AGM-4x is based on the AGM-158 LRASM. This was a missile originally made in the 21st century to attack naval ships. It has been modernized and reworked to serve once more. This is a special nuclear tipped version.

One Mk 41 VLS cell can hold 1 AGM-4x missile and this VLS pack has 8 cells. This version fires all the missiles in a burst.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-4x LRASM Nuclear VLS

Secondary Weapons.description: Originally a nuclear anti ballistic missile, it has been updated to instead attack fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Sprint ABM Nuclear VLS

Secondary Weapons.description: The UGM-1x Trident is a submarine launched ballistic missile that can also be used in space. It is part of the nuclear deterrence strategy. These missiles are made to strike at strategic targets.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion UGM-1x Trident Nuclear VLS

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.

This is a version made for heavy bombers.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GBU-1x Bomb Bay 50x Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.

This is a version for medium bombers.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GBU-1x Bomb Bay 40x Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.

This is a version for light bombers.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GBU-1x Bomb Bay 30x Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.

This is a version for larger strike fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GBU-1x Bomb Bay 20x Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.

This is a version for strike fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GBU-1x Bomb Bay 10x Mk1

Even though it is classified as a air to ground missile, this is a bit of a misnomer as it is actually a guided gliding bomb. It is used to allow our aircraft to safely launch bombs from beyond enemy air defense.

This is a version for heavy bombers.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-3x Bomb Bay 50 Mk1

This is a version for medium bombers.

This is a version for large strike fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-3x Bomb Bay 20 Mk1

Even though it is classified as a air to ground missile, this is a bit of a misnomer as it is actually a guided gliding bomb. It is used to allow our aircraft to safely launch bombs from beyond enemy air defense.

This is a version for strike fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-3x Bomb Bay 10 Mk1

The AGM-4x is based on the AGM-158 LRASM. This was a missile originally made in the 21st century to attack naval ships. It has been modernized and reworked to serve once more. This is a special nuclear tipped version.

This bomb bay is for heavy bombers.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-4x Nuclear Bomb Bay 50 Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AIM-3x Super AMRAAM is a long range mainly anti air missile, although it can be used against ground targets in an emergency. Much like the sidewinder, this missile can also be found on all of the branches of our military.

This is a special bay made to be mounted in the B1 lancer, converting it into a air to air monster.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AIM-3x AMRAAM B1 Lancer Bay

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Guided Penetration Bomb-1x Piercer is a guided bomb used to strike bunkers. It has been revamped to also strike Capital ships.

This is a version made to be mounted on special racks for the B52's external hardpoint.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion GBU-1x B52 External Rack Mk1

Even though it is classified as a air to ground missile, this is a bit of a misnomer as it is actually a guided gliding bomb. It is used to allow our aircraft to safely launch bombs from beyond enemy air defense.

This is a version made to be mounted on special racks for the B52's external hardpoint.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-3x B52 External Rack Mk1

weapon.ammo: Arion B1 Tactical Nuke bomb Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: Tactical nuclear bomb used both by strike fighters and bombers. It is smaller than the bombs normally used specially by bombers since it is made to strike high value targets instead of cities.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Tactical Nuclear B52 External Rack Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description:
The AGM-4x is based on the AGM-158 LRASM. This was a missile originally made in the 21st century to attack naval ships. It has been modernized and reworked to serve once more. This is a special nuclear tipped version.

This is a version made to be mounted on special racks for the B52's external hardpoint.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion AGM-4x Nuclear B52 External Rack Mk1

Secondary Weapons.description: A special ElectroMagnetic Launcher unit made to be mounted on fighters. It requires a spinal mount.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Fighter EML External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A special Pulse Laser unit made to be mounted on fighters. It requires a spinal mount.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Fighter PLSL External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A special Tactical Laser System unit made to be mounted on fighters. It requires a spinal mount.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Fighter TLS External Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The Archlight E.M.L is a specially built railgun for the X-02x Wyvern and ASF-01 Wyvern.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Arclight E.M.L

Secondary Weapons.description: The Purgatorio E.M.L is a specially built railgun for the CFA-44x Nosferatu and ASF-02 Nosferatu.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Purgatorio E.M.L

Secondary Weapons.description: The Zoisite Tactical Laser System is a specifically built laser for the ADFX-01 Morgan, ADF-01 Falken, ADF-11 Raven and ASF-0 Morgan, ADF-01 Falken, ADF-02 Raven.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion Zoisite T.L.S

Secondary Weapons.description: The Long Range Shockwave Missile is specifically built for the XFA-33 Fenrir and the ASF-04 Fenrir.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arion L.S.W.M

Secondary Weapons.description: The Sheragi are a warlike race, even now when they are secluded from the rest of the galaxy they are driven to develop weapons of utter devestation. This prototype weapon was designed to deal massive hull damage, to be used in conjunction with its sister ship's weapon.
Secondary Weapons.name: Shadow's Blade

Secondary Weapons.description: The Sheragi are a warlike race, even now when they are secluded from the rest of the galaxy they are driven to develop weapons of utter devestation. This prototype weapon was designed to disrupt enemy shields, to be used in conjunction with its sister ship's weapon.
Secondary Weapons.name: Light's Bane

Secondary Weapons.description: The Sheragi Kinetic Spear Launcher is a weapon designed to rip through the hulls of ships. The weapon fires a large unguided tungsten rod which completley penetrates shields. The fact it is made of solid metal makes this weapon very difficult to shoot down with standard Anti-Missile systems.
Secondary Weapons.name: Kinetic Spear Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: A newly developed Mereti weapon, the Automine Deployer forgoes the need to carry ammunition. Instead, the mines are constructed using Korath nanomachine technology. These weapons were developed exclusively for use by the Mechanized Mine automata.
Secondary Weapons.name: Automine Deployer

Secondary Weapons.description: The World Slicer is an orbital strike weapon that can carve deep into a planet's crust. Many worlds were destroyed in the Korath civil war by these tools of destruction.
Secondary Weapons.name: Korath Eliminator

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Fireswarm Missile is a cluster munition that carries a swarm of smaller missiles which can overwhelm slow defense systems.

	If multiple Fireswarm Launchers are installed, they will all fire simultaneously.
Secondary Weapons.name: Korath Fireswarm Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: The Scattermine Deployer is a crude device for deploying a cloud of stationary mines along the ship's wake. One drawback of deploying the mines in this manner is that premature detonation can damage the ship dropping the mines.
Secondary Weapons.name: Korath Scattermine

Secondary Weapons.description: The Salvager Turret is used to tow derelict ships away from dangerous battlefields.
Secondary Weapons.name: Korath Tractor

Secondary Weapons.description: Extremely High Explosive Anti-Ship Missile.
Secondary Weapons.name: XHEAS Missile BIMM

Secondary Weapons.description: Extremely High Explosive Anti-Ship Missile.
Secondary Weapons.name: XHEAS Missile BIMM(Rear)

Secondary Weapons.description: Akralva small torpedo launcher.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arziao Torpedo Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Akralva small torpedo launcher turret for defensive role.
Secondary Weapons.name: Arziao Torpedo Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: This weapon launches Varsrel drones which after being launched will begins to attack the target for a few second before running out of power.
Secondary Weapons.name: Varsrel Drone Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Unguided rockets fired in large burst to overwhelm the enemy's missile defence.
Secondary Weapons.name: Cveai Torpedo Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Initially designed as anti-fighter swarm turret but was also found to be sufficiently effective against large ships as well
Secondary Weapons.name: Cveai Torpedo Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: A large cannon used by Dels while looks outdated it can pack quite a punch.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dels Sokak Cannon

Secondary Weapons.description: Dels Sokak Cannon mounted on a turret.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dels Sokak Cannon Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: Dels missile.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dakte-1 Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Dels missile that splits into 8 smaller missiles when close to target.
Secondary Weapons.name: Saikel-4 Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Dels anti-warship missile, slow but powerful.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dalrel-8 Launching System

Secondary Weapons.description: Dels anti-warship missile, slow but powerful.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dalrel-8 VLS

Secondary Weapons.description: Zorcn finds the most effective way to get rid of their enemies is to hurl tons of missiles in a short burst that overwhelms the enemy's defense.
Secondary Weapons.name: Muaner Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Unguided rockets fired in large burst to overwhelm the enemy's missile defence.
Secondary Weapons.name: Ronc Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Initially designed as anti-fighter swarm turret but was also found to be sufficiently effective against large ships as well
Secondary Weapons.name: Ronc Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: With the deployment of larger warships well protected from swarm of missiles a new weapon was designed and deployed as an effort to defeat their very own missile defense.
Secondary Weapons.name: Durnske Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: A vertical launching version of Durnske Missile launcher, this requires special system and design to support VLS so only a few ship specifically designed for can install this weapon.
Secondary Weapons.name: Durnske VLS

Secondary Weapons.description: Revos energy-based homing projectile.
Secondary Weapons.name: Anor Missile

Secondary Weapons.description: Donko Hasus missile can avoid obstructions.
Secondary Weapons.name: Hasus Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Kumakk shield disruption missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: Loku'nol Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Kumakk shield disruption missiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: Loku'nol Missile Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: Erm Shield piercing missile.
Secondary Weapons.name: Atarkor Missile

Secondary Weapons.description: Single shot missile used by Kasiva fighters.
Secondary Weapons.name: Skile Missile

Secondary Weapons.description: Ultaka splitting energy missile E40R-D is the most effective weapon aginst both tiny fighers and big battleships as their splited energy projectile will home around the enemy making them extremely hard to dodge and can drain energy from ships with thick missile defense by making the Anti-missiles busy shoting tiny fragments down allowing larger missile to get pass the missile defences, if Anti-missiles target the larger missile the tiny missile fragment can hit and deal ionize the enemy.
Secondary Weapons.name: E40R-D

Secondary Weapons.description: Ultaka's energy torpedo
Secondary Weapons.name: E40R-E

Secondary Weapons.description: Sigarl mine used by Wallgi, shielded and cloaks and will activate when target enters the area.
Secondary Weapons.name: Sikarl Mine Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: A giant sub-light beam gun that will reduce most target to the very basic of their structure, while not the most lethal it remains intimidating enough to scare off most enemies.
Secondary Weapons.name: Zis Dragon's Breath

Secondary Weapons.description:
Old Zis weapon system modelled after a naval weapon, filled with exotic materials that gains energy over range.

This weapon gains damage at longer range, deploy at long range for full effectiveness.
Secondary Weapons.name: Syfar-3 Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: 5-tube torpedo launcher firing in sequence.
Secondary Weapons.name: Syfar-5 Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: 5-tube torpedo launcher firing in salvo
Secondary Weapons.name: Syfar-Penta Turret

Secondary Weapons.description:
Array of Rozzen missile launchers and missile generator machines.

Instead of installing missile launchers on a gun port, Rozzen VLS are installed on turret mounts.
Secondary Weapons.name: Rozzen VLS Array

Secondary Weapons.description:
.

	[Kuzaun missiles are a one-shot weapon: each missile occupies a gun slot, and after it is fired, the slot it was in is left empty.]
Secondary Weapons.name: Kuzaun Missile

Secondary Weapons.description: Kroom short range single-shot missile, used primarily by Kroom Kanai.
Secondary Weapons.name: Karar Missile

Secondary Weapons.description: Kroom powerful burst fire torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Golkar Torpedo Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Kroom powerful burst fire torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Golkar Torpedo Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: Ceasrilis missile
Secondary Weapons.name: Sihryi Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Ceasrilis mine
Secondary Weapons.name: Mviorsin Gravimetric Mine

Secondary Weapons.description: Ceasrilis missile.
Secondary Weapons.name: Disheir Missile Deployer

Secondary Weapons.description: Bam
Secondary Weapons.name: Sankrit D-Matter Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: Booom
Secondary Weapons.name: Quartic Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
This non-turreted version of the Langrage Hyper-Heaver lacks the ability to rotate itself, but each shot delivers a larger payload.

	At close range, the heaved langrage merely forces the enemy back. As the launch field collapses and the langrage returns fully to normal space, however, it is rent into a rapidly-expanding cloud of deadly projectiles.
Secondary Weapons.name: Langrage Hyper-Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Scattershot Gun racks shells that split into multiple shots which spread out to cover a wide area.

	Genesis mechanical weapons technology is far ahead of their energy weapons development. The loading systems on them are less likely to jam compared to species that put more resources on developing their energy weapons.
Secondary Weapons.name: Scattershot Gun

Secondary Weapons.description: The factories on larger Korath world ships produce a tremendous amount of waste. This weapon takes the most dangerous irradiated waste and fires it as a projectile that is very effective against shields.
Secondary Weapons.name: Korath Waste Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: This multipurpose weapon deals incredibly high shield damage at short range before the shot changes into an incredibly fast, shield-piercing blast.
Secondary Weapons.name: Quarg Culverin

Secondary Weapons.description: The Needler fires energized, biological shards of crystal that shatter on impact, wreaking massive havoc upon the target. They are semi-sentient and have guiding abilities.
Secondary Weapons.name: Needler

Secondary Weapons.description: The Adamas put the Needler on a turret mount.
Secondary Weapons.name: Turreted Needler

Secondary Weapons.description: The seeming reverence the Rebels have for fire appears embodied in this weapon. This pair of Fire-Lances mounted together in a turret do not merely create twin lances of fire: Rather, they begin to form a gestalt - a single, longer, hotter, and almost hypnotic column of fire.
Secondary Weapons.name: Rebels Blaze-Pike

Secondary Weapons.description: This is a powerful missile-artillery turret made by the Guz'. It contains special chemical cores to level up the shield damages.
Secondary Weapons.name: Guz' Artillery Turret

Secondary Weapons.description: When Dr. Richard J. Gatling invented the rapid-fire gun bearing his name in the 19th century, he hoped that its destructiveness would lead to the end of war itself. Over a millennium later, this modern incarnation of the Gatling Gun sees action in the stars, a testament to its fundamentally robust design - and Dr. Gatling's naivete. While capable of a high fire rate, this gun needs to cool down for twice as long as it fires, and can only sustain a maximum of three seconds of continuous fire.
Secondary Weapons.name: Guz' Gatlin' Gun

Secondary Weapons.description:
A missle system, Works internally like a fabricator.

It refits the materials of a railgun slug, and adds fuel from your ship.

This weapon does not do any shield damage but does lot of ion and heat damage that can esealy overheat and take there battery power to zero your enemy and disable his ship.
Secondary Weapons.name: Antimatter Railgun

Secondary Weapons.description:
Unlike the Empire Typhoon Bank, the Empire Torpedo Bank shoots 3 Empire Torpedo that are contained in the ammunition instead of shooting the whole torpedo at once.

It makes it so that the Empire Torpedo Bank is better for shooting extra large and very small ships and the Empire Typhoon Bank better for shooting all sorts of ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Empire Torpedo Bank

Secondary Weapons.description:
Unlike the Empire Torpedo Bank, the Empire Typhoon Bank shoots a whole Empire Torpedo that instead of shooting 3 Empire Torpedo that are contained in the ammunition

It makes it so that the Empire Torpedo Bank is better for shooting extra large and very small ships and the Empire Typhoon Bank better for shooting all sorts of ships.
Secondary Weapons.name: Empire Typhoon Bank

Secondary Weapons.description:
It has been centuries since the last nuclear war was fought, and until very recently, most people in the galaxy assumed that that era of chaos and destruction was forever behind us...

	[Nuclear missiles are a one-shot weapon: each missile occupies a gun slot, and after it is fired, the slot it was in is left empty.]
Secondary Weapons.name: Empire Nuke

Secondary Weapons.description: This launcher fires phasic munitions that split into a cloud of stationary mines that each do a considerable amount of damage if a ship crashes into them. However, if a ship hits the mine before it has a chance to deploy, the damage is considerably reduced.
Secondary Weapons.name: Phasic Mine Layer

Secondary Weapons.description: Empire Emergency Deployer is used by the Empire Navy in emergency situations, to launch their installed Compact Countermesure Modules on their enemies, which produce deadly damages.
Secondary Weapons.name: Empire Emergency Deployer

Secondary Weapons.description:
It has been centuries since the last nuclear war was fought, and until very recently, most people in the galaxy assumed that that era of chaos and destruction was forever behind us...

	[Nuclear missiles are a one-shot weapon: each missile occupies a gun slot, and after it is fired, the slot it was in is left empty.]
Secondary Weapons.name: Empire Nuke Fabricator

Secondary Weapons.description: A crude but impressive-looking weapon, the Flamethrower ignites your hyperspace fuel and directs a stream of it towards your adversaries. The damage it does is relatively minor, but it can be useful for causing a target that is already operating near its thermal capacity to overheat, temporarily taking it out of the fight.
Secondary Weapons.name: Ion Plasma Thrower

Secondary Weapons.description: Your experience as well as your scanners can't make any sense of this weapon. You can't figure out how to make it work. The only thing that you know about this thing is that it needs to be powered by a lot of energy and produce a large amount of heat. It seems the Cromha Empire know how to keep things secret
Secondary Weapons.name: Caltalytic Tear Secret

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Ember Wastes are an anomalous region subject to forces that defy conventional physics: Energy spontaneously pouring from the vacuum, material density far greater than one would expect to find in space - even around a nebula, a concentration of wormholes unheard of in the galaxy, and regions where the universe itself seems to be in flux. This region, more than any building or ship, is the Remnant laboratory where they study the deepest workings of the universe.

	When asked to clarify whether the name refers to either ripping or crying, the technician looks at you with a curious expression, and replies 'both.' They then go on to explain that a very simplistic explanation for this weapon is that it is making micro-tears in the fabric of space-time, then cauterizing them together again. Should not the Ember Wastes cry at the necessity of such weapons?

	These massive weapons require special hardpoints, and are built in such few number that the Remnant distribute them directly on an as-needed basis. Due to the prodigious energy and fuel requirements, only the most massive of Remnant ships can support regular use of these weapons.
Secondary Weapons.name: Caltalytic Tear

Secondary Weapons.description: This is a personally obtained prototype Fusion Cannon, a deadly, massive spinal weapon. Where it came from, nobody knows except the owner, and those who wish to ask are too afraid of being on the receiving end.
Secondary Weapons.name: Prototype Fusion Cannon (Empire)

Secondary Weapons.description: The ancient Sheragi superweapon is simple in concept, but the cost involved in developing something like it is exorbitant. It's hard to envision what could have motivated the creation of such a thing. It uses an obscene amount of energy to trigger an extremely powerful thermonuclear reaction, directing most of the energy from the resulting explosion forwards in a devastatingly powerful beam of gamma radiation.
Secondary Weapons.name: Dragonflame Cannon (Empire)

Secondary Weapons.description: Electromagnetic pulse weapons were developed by the Remnant during the early days of their colony, when they were living in fear that the Alphas would overrun human space and expand beyond it.
Secondary Weapons.name: EMP Torpedo Bay

Secondary Weapons.description:
Electromagnetic pulse weapons were originally developed by the Remnant during the early days of their colony, when they were living in fear that the Alphas would overrun human space and expand beyond it.

Centuries later, the Teciimach revision includes a range of upgrades to their effectiveness, efficiency, reliability, and safety. The Remnant attribute these improvements to a mix of the latest research and secrets uncovered by Warren research teams.
Secondary Weapons.name: Teciimach Bay

Secondary Weapons.description:
While originally developed as a heavy weapon to paralyze enemy capital ships, the Remnant have utilized on-the-spot assembly techniques to support their use on smaller ships. These pods sacrifice multiple assembly systems in order to fit them onto interceptor-class vessels.

	Despite this explanation, a careful examination of these bays and pods suggest that there is much more here than their volume would suggest.
Secondary Weapons.name: Teciimach Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Ember Wastes are an anomalous region subject to forces that defy conventional physics: Energy spontaneously pouring from the vacuum, material density far greater than one would expect to find in space - even around a nebula, a concentration of wormholes unheard of in the galaxy, and regions where the universe itself seems to be in flux. This region, more than any building or ship, is the Remnant laboratory where they study the deepest workings of the universe.

	When asked to clarify whether the name refers to either ripping or crying, the technician looks at you with a curious expression, and replies 'both.' They then go on to explain that a very simplistic explanation for this weapon is that it is making micro-tears in the fabric of space-time, then cauterizing them together again. Should not the Ember Wastes cry at the necessity of such weapons?

	These massive weapons require special hardpoints, and are built in such few number that the Remnant distribute them directly on an as-needed basis. Due to the prodigious energy and fuel requirements, only the most massive of Remnant ships can support regular use of these weapons.
Secondary Weapons.name: Ember Tear

Secondary Weapons.description: Lumba Piercer Missiles carry a pair of warheads. The first, a smaller one in the very tip of the missile, explodes on impact to blast a hole in the ship's shields to allow some of the subsequent, larger explosion to pierce through.
Secondary Weapons.name: Lumba Piercer Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: The Ion Missile Pod proved to be an effective weapon in early conflicts with the Korath by overpowering early Korath anti-missile defenses. But just as the Bunrodea developed technology to combat Korath weaponry, the Korath did the same, prompting them to create their own rapid-fire anti-missile turret that limited the usefulness of the Swarm Pod against some Korath targets.
Secondary Weapons.name: Ion Missile Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Draining Rocket Fabricator is one of the greatest Lumbarian Fire Corporation weapons.It is an all-in-one fabricator that convert 4 Ion Missile into one powerful missile that is shot by the fabricator turret. The missile is already powerful itself by its enormous shield and hull damage but it will also drain the target shields and fuel over time by a noticeable amount.

The only thing that may be missing to the Draining Rocket Fabricator is that it doesn't have any Ion Missile capacity at all integrated.
Secondary Weapons.name: Draining Rocket Fabricator

Secondary Weapons.description: Imperial navy standard plasma torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Plasma Torpedo Tube

Secondary Weapons.description: Imperial navy standard melta torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Melta Torpedo Tube

Secondary Weapons.description: Imperial navy shortburn torpedo, these torpedoes are faster than regular torpedo but don't last as long.
Secondary Weapons.name: Shortburn Torpedo Tube

Secondary Weapons.description: These torpedoes are telepathically guided allowing it to track and hit enemy with great precision.
Secondary Weapons.name: Guided Torpedo Tube

Secondary Weapons.description: Imperial navy seeking torpedo.
Secondary Weapons.name: Seeking Torpedo Tube

Secondary Weapons.description: Imperial navy vortex torpedo creates a short-living "hole" into the immaterium when hit sucking in everything within it vicinity causing massive damage to ships hit by it and anything else that comes close.
Secondary Weapons.name: Vortex Torpedo Tube

Secondary Weapons.description: Launches short-ranged boarding torpedo at enemy. Over a short period of time the boarding squad will disrupt the enemy ship discharging their energy, messing with their engines, or even blow out a chunk of armour from inside.
Secondary Weapons.name: Boarding Torpedo Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
Atmospheric Incinerator Torpedo launcher. Only to be used in extreme case with approval from an Inquisitor or a Chapter Master.

Buying this outfit will allow you to get Exterminatus missions from Inquisitors, be careful.

[Warning: blowing up planets will certainly make a mess with vanilla storylines and lock you out of it permanently.]
Secondary Weapons.name: Atmospheric Incinerator Tube

Secondary Weapons.description:
Mortalis Atmospheric Launcher. Only to be used in extreme case with approval from an Inquisitor or a Chapter Master.

[Warning: blowing up planets will certainly make a mess with vanilla storylines and lock you out of it permanently.]
Secondary Weapons.name: Mortalis Atmospheric Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description:
Two-stage Cyclonic Torpedo launcher. Only to be used in extreme case with approval from an Inquisitor or a Chapter Master.

[Warning: blowing up planets will certainly make a mess with vanilla storylines and lock you out of it permanently.]
Secondary Weapons.name: Two-stage Cyclonic Tube

Secondary Weapons.description:
The XLR-93 Railgun is one of the few weapons designed solely by the Enclave's government-owned labs without any input from XSZ.

	Using principles first used in warfare in the early 21st century, the XLR-93 Railgun accelerates a metal projectile along a track using a series of electromagnets, before shooting the projectile at a target. XLR-93 Railguns have been proven to have supreme shield-piercing capabilities, and are devastating against a target with no shields.
Secondary Weapons.name: XLR-93 Railgun

Secondary Weapons.description: XSZ has been making massive advancements recently in nuclear weaponry.
Secondary Weapons.name: Nuclear Missile MK 5

Secondary Weapons.description: The Phase Missile is a terrifying weapon designed by the Kaltheim to warp in and out of this plane of existence as it flies, allowing it to dodge anti-missile systems entirely. However, this universe-swap technology severely limits the projectile's range.
Secondary Weapons.name: Phase Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: The Rynar Missile Launcher is the Launcher for the indestructible Rynar Missile. Although
Secondary Weapons.name: Rynar Missile Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: The way the advanced pod fires looks suspiciously like a Pug seeker. Maybe they reverse-engineered alien tech to make it? Finisher Torpedoes are one of the Heliarchs' most dreaded weapons. In fact, in one way or another most of their other weapons merely exist to hold a ship in place for long enough for a barrage of Finishers to destroy it.
Secondary Weapons.name: Advanced Finisher Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: A weapon inspired by the fire breathing Nova Fireflies. An extra tank of hyperspace fuel is included.
Secondary Weapons.name: Flare Belcher

Secondary Weapons.description: A weapon inspired by the prickly Star Gazers. There is a slight delay while it regenerates the quills used as ammunition.
Secondary Weapons.name: Quill Launcher

Secondary Weapons.description: A primitive version of the modern Thunderhead Launcher. The Thunderhead Pod is almost entirely dependent on external ammunition storage, resulting in a slower rate of fire. Unlike the modern launchers, these pods do not fire simultaneously when multiples are installed on a ship.
Secondary Weapons.name: Thunderhead Pod

Secondary Weapons.description: Displacers are Trackers that have had their optical tracking hardware replaced with holographic projectors. These create phantom missiles that escort the Displacer towards its target, helping it to get through the enemy's anti-missile defenses.
Secondary Weapons.name: Hai Displacer Pod

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Hai once deployed Nutcracker missiles long ago against an enemy occupying a galactic region far from their space. The campaign didn't end well. After it was over, this weapon was abandoned over concerns about its collateral damage and potential lingering effects resulting from prolonged use.

	This weapon is no longer in production. It is a relic from an age of Hai domination and galactic conquest.

	[Nutcracker missiles are a one-shot weapon: each missile occupies a gun slot, and after it is fired, the slot it was in is left empty.]
Secondary Weapons.name: Hai Nutcracker

Secondary Weapons.description:
The Phantom Tracker generates a realistic hologram of a Hai Tracker missile. At minimum, the enemy anti-missile defense wastes resources firing at it. But this can also serve as a decoy to allow other, real, missiles through to hit their target.

	Because the missile isn't real, guidance is accomplished entirely through visual positioning data fed into the Phantom Tracker.
Secondary Weapons.name: Phantom Tracker (Gun)

Secondary Weapons.description:
Hai tacticians were taught to look for the tell-tale signs of Phantom Trackers. They have a shorter range than real Trackers due to limitations of the holographic technology. They move slightly faster. And undisciplined gunners will fire them more often than real tracker pods are capable of doing.
