Ammunition.description: Missile storage for Dels Saikel missiles.
Ammunition.name: Saikel-4 Magazines

Ammunition.description: Dels Anti-Ship Missile
Ammunition.name: Dalrel-8 Missile

Ammunition.description: Ammunition for Utvr40 gun.
Ammunition.name: Utvr40 Shell

Ammunition.description: Ammo Storage for Utvr40 gun
Ammunition.name: Utvr40 Storage Room

Ammunition.description: Ammo for Ronc launcher.
Ammunition.name: Ronc Rocket

Ammunition.description: A machine-friendly crate that allows Ronc Pod easy access to extra ammunition.
Ammunition.name: Ronc Storage Crate

Ammunition.description: Durnske Anti-Ship Missile
Ammunition.name: Durnske Missile

Ammunition.description: Ammunition required for Etkan CIWS to fire.
Ammunition.name: Etkan Rocket

Ammunition.description: This missile is fired from a Hasus Launcher.
Ammunition.name: Hasus Missile

Ammunition.description: Kumakk Loku'nol Missile
Ammunition.name: Loku'nol Missile

Ammunition.description: Loku'nol Missile Storage.
Ammunition.name: Loku'nol Missile Storage

Ammunition.description: Ammo for Erader Aserap autocannon and Kakuran Energy Cannon
Ammunition.name: Aserap Ammo

Ammunition.description: Ammo Storage for Aserap autocannon and Kakuran energy cannon.
Ammunition.name: Aserap Ammo Storage

Ammunition.description: Ammo for Erader Aserap autocannon and Kakuran Energy Cannon
Ammunition.name: Kainar Slug

Ammunition.description: Ammo Storage for Aserap autocannon and Kakuran energy cannon.
Ammunition.name: Kainar Slug Storage

Ammunition.description: A Meteor Missile serves as ammunition for the Meteor Missile Launcher. Each missile launcher has the capacity for 30 missiles; you cannot install missiles if you have not first purchased a launcher to store them in.
Ammunition.name: Yeutark Shell

Ammunition.description: The Meteor Missile Box is used to store extra ammunition for Meteor Missile Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Yeutark Shell Storage

Ammunition.description: Syfar Torpedo for Syfar Torpedo launchers.
Ammunition.name: Syfar Torpedo

Ammunition.description: Storage for Zis Syfar storpedo.
Ammunition.name: Syfar Torpedo Storage

Ammunition.description: Ammo for Krogak missile launcher.
Ammunition.name: Krogak Missile

Ammunition.description: The Krogak Missile Box is used to store extra ammunition for Krogak Missile Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Krogak Missile Box

Ammunition.description: Golkar Torpedo
Ammunition.name: Golkar Torpedo

Ammunition.description: Golkar Torpedo Storage.
Ammunition.name: Golkar Torpedo Storage

Ammunition.description: Sihryi missile
Ammunition.name: Sihryi Missile

Ammunition.description: Sihryi Missile Storage.
Ammunition.name: Sihryi Missile Storage

Ammunition.description: Mviorsin mine
Ammunition.name: Mviorsin Mine

Ammunition.description: Mviorsin Mine Storage.
Ammunition.name: Mviorsin Mine Storage

Ammunition.description: Disheir missile
Ammunition.name: Disheir Missile

Ammunition.description: Disheir Missiles Storage.
Ammunition.name: Disheir Missile Storage

Ammunition.description: The missiles for the D-Matter Launcher
Ammunition.name: D-Matter

Ammunition.description: Boooom
Ammunition.name: Quartic Missile

Ammunition.description:
Scattershot shells are packed into special racks designed for loading the Scattershot Gun.

	Genesis ammunition, professionally manufactured by their industrial mass production factories, is a critical element to many of their weapons. Quality control measures at these facilities make them less likely to jam.
Ammunition.name: Scattershot Ammo

Ammunition.description: Scattershot Racks are used to store extra ammunition for Scattershot Guns.
Ammunition.name: Scattershot Rack

Ammunition.description: This irradiated industrial waste is a byproduct of Korath manufacturing processes.
Ammunition.name: Korath Waste

Ammunition.description: A Needle Shard is ammunition for the Needler; without a Needler to store them in, you cannot purchase or use Needle Shards. Each gun stores 800, and each turret stores 1750.
Ammunition.name: Needle Shard

Ammunition.description: Guz' Heavy Missiles are strong kinetic missiles that contains special chemical cores to level up the shields damages.
Ammunition.name: Guz' Heavy Missile

Ammunition.description: This simple cartridge is the ammunition for the Gatling Gun, with a projectile of depleted nuclear fuel or an illuminated tracer round. Since this ammunition is primarily manufactured on pirate worlds by slave children in poor working conditions, muzzle velocity can vary by up to 30%, and tracer distribution is seldom uniform.
Ammunition.name: Gatlin' Guz' Ammo

Ammunition.description: Bullet Boxes are used to store extra ammunition for Gatling Guns.
Ammunition.name: Guz' Bullet Boxes

Ammunition.description: This torpedo can emit electromagnetic pulses, interfering with a ship's generators.
Ammunition.name: EMP Torpedo

Ammunition.description:
The EMP Torpedo Storage Bay is used to store extra ammunition for weapons that use EMP torpedoes.

	In addition to its ammunition capacity, the storage bay can also contain a small amount of charge, enough to let an otherwise battery-less ship fire EMP Torpedoes.
Ammunition.name: EMP Torpedo Storage Bay

Ammunition.description:
This canister contains everything required to assemble a Teciimach Torpedo. These weapons emit strong electromagnetic pulses which interfere with a ship's generators and neutralize a portion of their energy.

	Unlike the previous generation of "EMP Torpedoes," the Teciimach torpedoes actively shape their emission pattern to avoid impacting their allies.
Ammunition.name: Teciimach Canister

Ammunition.description:
The Teciimach Canister Rack is used to store extra sets of components, both to expand the capacity of a ship, and on carriers for resupplying fighters.

	In addition to its ammunition capacity, the storage bay can also contain a small amount of charge, enough to let an otherwise battery-less ship assemble Teciimach Torpedoes.
Ammunition.name: Teciimach Canister Rack

Ammunition.description: This missile is fired from a Lumba Piercer Pod.
Ammunition.name: Lumba Piercer

Ammunition.description: The Lumba Piercer Array is used to store extra ammunition for Lumba Piercer Pod.
Ammunition.name: Lumba Piercer Array

Ammunition.description: Ion Missile Clips Clips provide a sizable increase in ammo capacity for Ion Missile Pods, holding a respectable 200 missiles able to be swiftly loaded into a launcher after its current clip is empty.
Ammunition.name: Ion Missile Clip

Ammunition.description: Ion Missile missiles are small, fast moving munitions for the Ion Missile Pod.
Ammunition.name: Ion Missile

Ammunition.description: Common Imperium plasma torpedo.
Ammunition.name: Imperium Plasma Torpedo

Ammunition.description: Rare and powerful Imperial Vortex torpedo.
Ammunition.name: Imperium Vortex Torpedo

Ammunition.description: A specialized torpedo with a squad of Imperial Navy's boarding troops to disrupt the enemy ship.
Ammunition.name: Boarding Torpedo

Ammunition.description: A type of cyclonic torpedo which lights the entire planet atmosphere on fire killing everything on the surface.
Ammunition.name: Atmospheric Incinerator Torpedo

Ammunition.description: Mortalis Atmospheric Missile is an exterminatus-grade phosphex weapon capable of burning entire planet in a salvo with little to no oxygen needed.
Ammunition.name: Mortalis Atmospheric Missile

Ammunition.description: A type of cyclonic torpedo which upon impact, fires a second stage which can penetrate deep into the planet's core and destabilize cracking the planet and make it explode.
Ammunition.name: Two-stage Cyclonic Torpedo

Ammunition.description:
Ball-bearings are simple steel spheres, designed to be fired from the XLR-93 Railgun. The latest versions of military-grade ball-bearings are mostly solid steel, with basic homing systems installed at the core of the sphere, as the magnetic forces exerted on the projectile during firing disrupt most electrical systems.

 You cannot install ball-bearings unless you have also installed a launcher to fire them from.
Ammunition.name: Ball-bearing

Ammunition.description: The Phase Missile is ammunition for the Phase Missile Launcher- without the launcher, you cannot install Phase Missiles. Each launcher can store up to 100 Phase Missiles.
Ammunition.name: Phase Missile

Ammunition.description: Before they invented the Hyperdrive, the Gaguka had wars with each other. Allthough everything else is out of date by millennia, the Rynar Missile and its Launcher are still being improved.
Ammunition.name: Rynar Missile

Ammunition.description:
This is ammunition for a Displacer Pod.

	The Displacer only generates holographic decoys after it launches. Managing ammunition inventory would be unnecessarily difficult otherwise.
Ammunition.name: Hai Displacer

Ammunition.description:
The Displacer Storage Pod is used to store extra ammunition for Displacer Pods.

	The Unfettered now have a new hazing ritual to torture fresh recruits: They are instructed to double check the inventory and confirm that none of the stored Displacers are holographic.
Ammunition.name: Displacer Storage Pod

Ammunition.description: This box of rocks holds extra asteroids for the Asteroid Catapult. Since it's basically a cargo container, it occupies your cargo hold rather than your ship's outfit systems. Five crewmembers are needed to transport the asteroids from the ship's cargo bay to the catapult and load it.
Ammunition.name: Asteroid Storage

Ammunition.description: The most difficult part of operating an Asteroid Catapult is locating ammunition with the right size, shape, density, and magnetic properties.
Ammunition.name: Metallic Asteroid

Ammunition.description: Inferno Rockets are ammunition for the Inferno Rocket Launcher. You cannot install one unless you have first installed a launcher to fire it from. Each launcher holds up to 20 rockets.
Ammunition.name: Inferno Rocket

Ammunition.description: The Inferno Rocket Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Inferno Rocket Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Inferno Rocket Rack

Ammunition.description:
A Stinger Missile serves as ammunition for the Stinger Missile Launcher. You cannot install missiles if you have not first purchased a pod, launcher, or rack to store them in.

	Mass produced under horrendous conditions on pirate worlds, Stinger Missiles utilize outdated radar tracking technology and are also easily destroyed by anti-missile weapons. Often, the slaves assigned to manufacture them are sick or elderly. In other words, the ones too weak to fight or have low potential future value. Accidental exposure to the toxic materials in these weapons during construction is common, resulting in a high mortality rate among the laborers.
Ammunition.name: Stinger Missile

Ammunition.description: The Stinger Missile Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Stinger Missile Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Stinger Missile Rack

Ammunition.description: The Swingfire Missile is ammunition for the Swingfire Missile Launcher. You cannot install missiles if you have not first purchased a pod, launcher, or rack to store them in.
Ammunition.name: Swingfire Missile

Ammunition.description: The Swingfire Missile Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Swingfire Missile Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Swingfire Missile Rack

Ammunition.description: Culminator Storage Tubes are more compact than Finisher Storage Tubes, but lack the additional energy storage capacity of its modern counterpart.
Ammunition.name: Culminator Storage Tube

Ammunition.description: This extremely powerful missile is ammunition for the Coalition Culminator Pod. Not as maneuverable as a Finisher Torpedo and equipped with simpler tracking technology, a Culminator strike is still as destructive as that of their modern equivalents.
Ammunition.name: Culminator Torpedo

Ammunition.description:
Genesis Flak Shells are ammunition for the Genesis Flak Turret. Each turret holds up to 40 shells.

	Genesis ammunition, professionally manufactured by their industrial mass production factories, is a critical element to many of their weapons. Quality control measures at these facilities make them less likely to jam.
Ammunition.name: Genesis Flak Shell

Ammunition.description: The Genesis Flak Shell Crate is used to store extra ammunition for Genesis Flak Turrets.
Ammunition.name: Genesis Flak Shell Crate

Ammunition.description:
In simple terms, "caliber" refers to the diameter of a gun's barrel. Guns are meant to be loaded with bullets that match their caliber. This ammunition is appropriately sized to be used with the High Caliber Gun. Attempting to load it with lower caliber ammunition can result in jamming or other firing mishaps.

	Genesis ammunition, professionally manufactured by their industrial mass production factories, is a critical element to many of their weapons. Quality control measures at these facilities make them less likely to jam.
Ammunition.name: High Calibur Ammo

Ammunition.description: High Caliber Ammo Boxes are used to store extra ammunition for High Caliber Guns.
Ammunition.name: High Calibur Boxes

Ammunition.description:
This is ammunition for a Magnetic Mine Deployer.

	Development of this weapon was rushed to deployment at the request of Navarchs who have explored the Ember Wastes.
Ammunition.name: Magnetic Mine

Ammunition.description:
The Magnetic Mine Rack is used to store extra ammunition for a Magnetic Mine Deployer.

	These storage racks also act as a faraday cage to prevent the stored mines from accidentally interfering with the generators of the ship while carrying them.
Ammunition.name: Magnetic Mine Rack

Ammunition.description: A Meteor Missile serves as ammunition for the Meteor Missile Launcher. Each missile launcher has its own capacity; you cannot install missiles if you have not first purchased a pod, launcher, or storage to store them in.
Ammunition.name: Meteor Missile

Ammunition.description: The Meteor Missile Box is used to store extra ammunition for Meteor Missile Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Meteor Missile Box

Ammunition.description: The Sidewinder Missile is ammunition for the Sidewinder Missile Launcher; each launcher that you have installed can be armed with up to 45 of them, while pods can carry 4. You cannot install a missile without a pod or launcher to fire it from.
Ammunition.name: Sidewinder Missile

Ammunition.description: The Sidewinder Missile Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Sidewinder Missile Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Sidewinder Missile Rack

Ammunition.description: A Javelin missile is ammunition for the Javelin Pod; without a Pod to store them in you cannot purchase or use Javelins.
Ammunition.name: Javelin

Ammunition.description: The Javelin Storage Crate is used to store extra ammunition for Javelin Pods.
Ammunition.name: Javelin Storage Crate

Ammunition.description: Torpedoes are ammunition for the Torpedo Launcher. Each Torpedo Launcher can hold 30 of them. You cannot install torpedoes unless you have also installed a launcher to fire them from.
Ammunition.name: Torpedo

Ammunition.description: The Torpedo Storage Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Torpedo Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Torpedo Storage Rack

Ammunition.description: Typhoon Torpedoes are ammunition for the Typhoon Launcher. Each launcher can hold 30 of them. You cannot install Typhoon Torpedoes unless you have also installed a launcher to fire them from.
Ammunition.name: Typhoon Torpedo

Ammunition.description: The Typhoon Storage Tube is used to store extra ammunition for Typhoon Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Typhoon Storage Tube

Ammunition.description: Heavy Rockets are ammunition for the Heavy Rocket Launcher. You cannot install one unless you have first installed a launcher to fire it from. Each launcher holds up to 20 rockets.
Ammunition.name: Heavy Rocket

Ammunition.description: The Heavy Rocket Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Heavy Rocket Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Heavy Rocket Rack

Ammunition.description: This simple cartridge is the ammunition for the Gatling Gun, with a projectile of depleted nuclear fuel or an illuminated tracer round. Since this ammunition is primarily manufactured on pirate worlds by slave children in poor working conditions, muzzle velocity can vary by up to 30%, and tracer distribution is seldom uniform.
Ammunition.name: Gatling Gun Ammo

Ammunition.description: Bullet Boxes are used to store extra ammunition for Gatling Guns.
Ammunition.name: Bullet Boxes

Ammunition.description: This missile is fired from a Korath Piercer Launcher.
Ammunition.name: Korath Piercer

Ammunition.description: The Korath Piercer Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Korath Piercer Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Korath Piercer Rack

Ammunition.description: This is ammunition for a Korath Minelayer. Each mine splits into eleven submunitions after it is deployed.
Ammunition.name: Korath Mine

Ammunition.description: The Korath Mine Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Korath Minelayers.
Ammunition.name: Korath Mine Rack

Ammunition.description: Skipper Railgun Slugs incorporate energy-discharging capacitors that deal a small amount of ion damage to their target. Although not terribly damaging, this ion damage combined with the significant recoil that each shot has turns Flea drones into effective long-range support ships.
Ammunition.name: Railgun Slug

Ammunition.description: This railgun slug rack is used to store and load extra Skipper Railgun ammunition.
Ammunition.name: Railgun Slug Rack

Ammunition.description: This is ammunition for a Tracker Pod.
Ammunition.name: Hai Tracker

Ammunition.description: The Tracker Storage Pod is used to store extra ammunition for Tracker Pods.
Ammunition.name: Tracker Storage Pod

Ammunition.description: This torpedo can emit electromagnetic pulses, interfering with a ship's generators.
Ammunition.name: EMP Torpedo

Ammunition.description:
The EMP Torpedo Storage Bay is used to store extra ammunition for weapons that use EMP torpedoes.

	In addition to its ammunition capacity, the storage bay can also contain a small amount of charge, enough to let an otherwise battery-less ship fire EMP Torpedoes.
Ammunition.name: EMP Torpedo Storage Bay

Ammunition.description:
This canister contains everything required to assemble a Teciimach Torpedo. These weapons emit strong electromagnetic pulses which interfere with a ship's generators and neutralize a portion of their energy.

	Unlike the previous generation of "EMP Torpedoes," the Teciimach torpedoes actively shape their emission pattern to avoid impacting their allies.
Ammunition.name: Teciimach Canister

Ammunition.description:
The Teciimach Canister Rack is used to store extra sets of components, both to expand the capacity of a ship, and on carriers for resupplying fighters.

	In addition to its ammunition capacity, the storage bay can also contain a small amount of charge, enough to let an otherwise battery-less ship assemble Teciimach Torpedoes.
Ammunition.name: Teciimach Canister Rack

Ammunition.description: The projectiles fired by the Sjeja Kinetic Lance are too large to be synthesized on-the-fly from the ship's reserves, and must be carried separately.
Ammunition.name: High-Velocity Spike

Ammunition.description: Though the built-in ammunition reserves of the Sjeja Kinetic Lance are sufficient for all but the most protracted engagements, the High Houses do manufacture this additional storage unit for use on their largest warships. The rack includes a small set of batteries to help support the high power costs of the Sjeja.
Ammunition.name: High-Velocity Spike Rack

Ammunition.description: These densely-wound metallic glass slugs are capable of inflicting a good amount of kinetic damage via hypervelocity impacts, but are easily stopped by momentum-repulsion shield systems.
Ammunition.name: Speck Round

Ammunition.description: While Speckle Coilguns carry a considerable amount of ammunition in their internal magazines, for longer expeditions or for resupply operations the Avgi use these compact ammunition storages.
Ammunition.name: Speck Magazine

Ammunition.description: To improve the combat endurance of ships that rely on flooding the battlespace with small missiles, this magazine extends the capacity of Nettle launch cells by loading new Nettle KKVs through the bottoms of the cells.
Ammunition.name: Nettle Magazine

Ammunition.description: This large ammunition storage loads new Orchid Missiles into the launch tubes with little more than a few cables, actuators, and solenoids. Designed to be as minimalistic as possible, the sheer size of each Orchid nonetheless makes this magazine rather bulky for the number of missiles it stores.
Ammunition.name: Orchid Magazine

Ammunition.description:
This remotely operated reloading bay, intended for use on carriers, can quickly replenish a docked fighter or drone with Ophrys Torpedoes. A generous stockpile of torpedoes allows a carrier to support multiple sorties before needing to resupply.

	The restocking system requires oversight by a small team of specialists to ensure no accidents occur during the loading process.
Ammunition.name: Ophrys Stockpile

Ammunition.description: In order to allow Heliarch ships to install more Finisher Storage Tubes, Heliarch engineers have incorporated a tiny battery pack into each module. This allows for Heliarch ships to have a respectable energy capacity while also carrying a fearsome number of Finishers.
Ammunition.name: Finisher Storage Tube

Ammunition.description:
A substantial fraction of the Heliarch military complex is devoted to supervising the refining, enrichment, and breeding of nuclear fuels. Having ensured a steady supply of feedstock, they are able to produce a selective set of highly exotic fissile materials. With minuscule critical masses and favorable neutronics properties, these carefully controlled isotopes are the key to giving the miniaturized nuclear warhead in the Finisher Torpedo enough power to deter any would-be threats to the Coalition.

	This extremely powerful but also expensive missile is ammunition for the Heliarch Finisher Pod.
Ammunition.name: Finisher Torpedo

Ammunition.description: This missile is fired from a Piercer Missile Launcher.
Ammunition.name: Piercer Missile

Ammunition.description: The Piercer Missile Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Piercer Missile Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Piercer Missile Rack

Ammunition.description: This is ammunition for a Cluster Mine Layer. Each mine splits into eleven submunitions after it is deployed.
Ammunition.name: Cluster Mine

Ammunition.description: The Cluster Mine Rack is used to store extra ammunition for Cluster Mine Layers.
Ammunition.name: Cluster Mine Rack

Ammunition.description: This rack stores additional Firelight missiles to feed into a Firelight Bank.
Ammunition.name: Firelight Storage Rack

Ammunition.description: The reactor element inside a Firelight Missile must be kept minimally active in order to ensure it is ready for launch. Although terribly inefficient, it nonetheless produces a trickle of power that can be tapped into when properly installed.
Ammunition.name: Firelight Missile

Ammunition.description: Massive in both size and destructive capability, the Firestorm Torpedo's enormous blast radius makes it a dangerous part of larger ship arsenals, despite the lack of more recent Korath innovations. The Firestorm Torpedo is used as ammo for the Firestorm Battery.
Ammunition.name: Firestorm Torpedo

Ammunition.description: This large cage-like rack is designed to be able to house several deadly Firestorm Torpedoes.
Ammunition.name: Firestorm Torpedo Rack

Ammunition.description: Swarm Clips provide a sizable increase in ammo capacity for Swarm Pods, holding a respectable 200 missiles able to be swiftly loaded into a launcher after its current clip is empty.
Ammunition.name: Swarm Clip

Ammunition.description: Swarm missiles are small, fast moving munitions for the Swarm Pod.
Ammunition.name: Swarm Missile

Ammunition.description: The Star Tail needs an extreme amount of energy that the Incipias are not able to create in a short amount of time. To accommodate this, the Star Tail Cell contains an energy-rich substance that releases its energy when fired. One of these cells holds enough energy to fire exactly one shot.
Ammunition.name: Star Tail Cell

Ammunition.description:
Because Star Tail Cells are highly volatile, they need a robust storage system. This radial design is able to withstand minor explosions by using a variant of a shield that can be deployed temporarily.

	One layer of this easily expandable system is already shipped with the gun itself. To increase storage space, more layers are simply stacked on top.
Ammunition.name: Star Tail Storage

Ammunition.description: Thunderhead cluster munitions are long-range Wanderer missiles that split into five fast and agile submunitions when they are close to their target. Each launcher can hold up to 40 of these.
Ammunition.name: Thunderhead Missile

Ammunition.description: The Thunderhead Storage Array is used to store extra ammunition for Thunderhead Launchers.
Ammunition.name: Thunderhead Storage Array

Engines.description: Zonai Afterburner.
Engines.name: Zonai Afterburner

Engines.description: Test.
Engines.name: Za-Class Thruster

Engines.description: Test.
Engines.name: Azag-Class Thruster

Engines.description: Test.
Engines.name: Za-Class Steering

Engines.description: Test.
Engines.name: Azag-Class Steering

Engines.description: This large model of Multi-Engine provides all the functions one could ask of an engine block, but is much larger, to facilitate the movement of the larger Casparnans it is installed on.
Engines.name: Large Multi-Engine

Engines.description:
This is a colossal afterburner, used by the Quaernan when its Waveform Engines just won't cut it. The sheer power that goes through the afterburner as it fires implies a level of either material strength or engineering mastery that current day humanity has not even begun to touch.

In addition to their primary firing mode, Quasar afterburners also have secondary burners that they use to shed slowing effects much more efficiently. These auxiliary burners, however, still require fuel.
Engines.name: Quasar Afterburner

Engines.description: The Waveform Thruster is a remarkably powerful set of engines, capable of pushing even the Quearnan to moderate speeds. Able to push around thousands of tons of mass with ease, these engines are quite comparable to human atomic engines, but their enormous size has given them room to prosper.
Engines.name: Waveform Thruster

Engines.description: This is a forward-reverse hybrid thruster, seemingly designed to counteract any forces experienced by the Quaernan in-flight. Though less powerful than the dedicated Waveform Thruster, it provides extra mobility in two directions instead of one.
Engines.name: Waveform Stabilizer

Engines.description: This is a vastly enlargened version of the Waveform Stabilizer, intended to provide frontal and reward mobility to balance out the firing forces of the Quaernan's weapons.
Engines.name: Large Waveform Stabilizer

Engines.description: While the Quaernan's thrusters are indeed impressive, this steering system is nearly twice the size, and can make the Quaernan turn impressively quickly. Some people believe they're so powerful they can damage planets, and indeed, the Quaernan actually imparted a not-insignificant amount of heat into Hope's atmospehre when lifting off.
Engines.name: Waveform Steering

Engines.description:
Though still hundreds of tons in size, these curious thrusters seem to be much smaller engines in comparison to the massive, hot-running Waveform engines. Most oddly, the engines seem to double as a containment field for a substance with negative mass; so much of it, in fact, that the entire assembly actually reduces the ship's mass by nearly 200 tons, as well as completely negating the weight of the engines themselves!

The engines themselves seem to be somewhat similar to ion engines, however, the assembly of the engines reduces slowing effects.
Engines.name: Exotic Engines

Engines.description: This is a type of ion engine that can turn and thrust both forwards and backwards; it also contains an afterburner, lending shocking maneuverability to the Alpaca drones it sits on. Despite its similarity to ion engines, it is remarkably powerful for its size, especially considering all it encompasses.
Engines.name: Small Multi-Engine

Engines.description: This is a larger type of Multi-Engine, capable of all the things the previous model is, but roughly twice as effective. It's certainly more than suitable for pushing the Llama-class Destroyer around.
Engines.name: Medium Multi-Engine

Engines.description: This is a stripped down multi-engine, likely designed for ships that don't require the flexiblity a multi-engine offers, compensating for this lack of versatility with raw power. It provides significantly higher thrust than any multi-engine, especially of comparable size.
Engines.name: Large Mono-Engine

Engines.description: Without their native galaxies resources, the Mil'taj have had to build ancient nuclear designs to move their ships. These engines are more powerful and space efficient than anything humanity could produce, but generate far more power and heat in exchange, leading to fast but resource hungry ships.
Engines.name: Class-1 Atomic Thruster

Engines.description: The Mil'taj value speed over all else, especially when dealing with the Quarg and the need to instantly respond to anywhere they may pop up.
Engines.name: Class-2 Atomic Thruster

Engines.description: Out of all nuclear powered engines in the galaxy, none come close to Mil'taj engines. A pirate would most likely spend a fortune to have engines this powerful to chase down their prey.
Engines.name: Class-3 Atomic Thruster

Engines.description: It took decades for the Mil'taj to properly recreate their old nuclear designs. Once engines of this size came off the production lines it became clear even the Quarg were outclassed in speed when these were installed on a warship.
Engines.name: Class-4 Atomic Thruster

Engines.description: This is the largest engine the Mil'taj can create with simple nuclear technology. Even the Mil'taj struggle to power and cool these behemoth engines.
Engines.name: Class-5 Atomic Thruster

Engines.description: Small and powerful, not much can beat the efficiency of Mil'taj tech with size and power, but few need as much support to keep their ships from overheating and running out of energy.
Engines.name: Class-1 Atomic Steering

Engines.description: Keeping track of efficient and blindingly fast Quarg craft is often difficult even with steering this powerful.
Engines.name: Class-2 Atomic Steering

Engines.description: Choosing between having power for your guns or turning for your ship is something Mil'taj officers often need to think about when deciding on the right engines for their ships.
Engines.name: Class-3 Atomic Steering

Engines.description: Large and costly, often the benefits of Mil'taj engines only outweigh their negatives because the enemy they fight are the Quarg. If their ships performed even slightly worse, the war would have likely been over long ago.
Engines.name: Class-4 Atomic Steering

Engines.description: Such massive engines are only necessary for the largest Mil'taj ships, and even then are often more powerful than common logic would imply.
Engines.name: Class-5 Atomic Steering

Engines.description: The Antimatter Thruster is an incredible engine that dominates all other types of thusters in the galaxy, they are made from a regenerative metal that can hold back the incredible energies of their antimatter cores. The Mil'taj only have a handful of these engines as they where produced with materials from their home galaxy.
Engines.name: Antimatter Thruster

Engines.description: The Antimatter Steering lets the largest Mil'taj ships easily outmaneuvere any other type of engine in the galaxy, they are made from a regenerative metal that can hold back the incredible energies of their antimatter cores. The Mil'taj only have a handful of these engines as they where produced with materials from their home galaxy.
Engines.name: Antimatter Steering

Engines.description:
Though the Syndicate doesn't sell these stock on their ships, they commonly offer these more powerful engines as an alternative to their ion engines. Though quite heat efficient, the energy draw these engines take is considerable by almost any standard.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 10KZ Electrostatic Thruster

Engines.description:
Unlike their ionic brethren, these small electrostatic thrusters can provide outsized maneuverability for medium to large ships. This does, however, come at a substantial energy cost.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 20KZ Electrostatic Thruster

Engines.description:
Electrostatic engines allow any ship to move swiftly with a low heat footprint, but they often require an upgrade of the ship's energy systems to be used.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 30KZ Electrostatic Thruster

Engines.description:
For most capital warships, this thruster's output is remarkable, but its energy requirements are a significant deterrent to any would-be purchasers.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 40KZ Electrostatic Thruster

Engines.description:
An engine this size demands a fusion reactor all its own, but provides similar output to atomic engines of the same size with a fraction of the heat footprint.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 50KZ Electrostatic Thruster

Engines.description:
Electrostatic engines were developed by the Syndicate for their large warships, allowing larger ships to turn quite effectively. They do, however, consume a significant amount of energy.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 10KZ Electrostatic Steering

Engines.description:
Thanks to the unique engineering at play, Electrostatic engines only produce marginally more heat than ion engines of the same size, while delivering more thrust and turn per ton than even plasma engines.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 20KZ Electrostatic Steering

Engines.description:
This is the standard steering engine for most Syndicate heavy warships. They allow a ship to remain exceptionally mobile, while also reserving a ship's cooling capacity for its weapons.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 30KZ Electrostatic Steering

Engines.description:
This large electrostatic steering system is on the large end for most human ships, but provides substantial mobility over more conventional ionic alternatives.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 40KZ Electrostatic Steering

Engines.description:
This is the most powerful electrostatic steering engine in human space, allowing almost any ship to turn as if it were a fighter. It does, however, draw a small reactor's worth of energy all by itself.

	Electrostatic engines provide a kick between Plasma and Atomic engines, but they require a considerable amount of energy to use, and they constantly draw power even when the ship is idle.
Engines.name: 50KZ Electrostatic Steering

Engines.description: Though the Remnant have always favored speed and agility over heavy staying power, there are some Remnant engineers who attempt to reconcile the gap. Magnetic Engines work in part by producing a powerful magnetic field, which allows them to stabilize a ship's shield matrix while operating.
Engines.name: Nickel Magnetic Thruster

Engines.description: Iron-sized Magnetic Engines are designed for medium warships or large freighters; they consume quite a bit of power when running, but provide a powerful shield restoration effect.
Engines.name: Iron Magnetic Thruster

Engines.description: The Remnant generally don't use the largest-sized magnetic engines due to their preference for smaller, sleeker ships. For a ship with the space and energy to use them, however, these engines can bolster recovery speed significantly.
Engines.name: Cobalt Magnetic Thruster

Engines.description: These small magnetic steering systems provide agility and durability to any craft they're installed on.
Engines.name: Nickel Magnetic Steering

Engines.description: Magnetic steering systems are generally less resource-intensive than standard Remnant ion engines, but their lesser thrust-per-ton means that they often don't move ships as fast as some captains would like.
Engines.name: Iron Magnetic Steering

Engines.description: Almost as large as a set of Smelter-class thrusters, this steering system guzzles a significant amount of energy while moving. However, the durability boost they provide when tangling with other ships is not to be ignored.
Engines.name: Cobalt Magnetic Steering

Engines.description: Building on their fuel-efficient thruster design, the Heliarchs designed this tiny, fuel reliant thruster that produce a much greater thrusting force than standard Coalition engines. To the end of allowing it to fit comfortably on fighters, it also contains a small reserve of fuel for emergency use.
Engines.name: Small Afterburner Module

Engines.description: For most ships, this is a substantially large afterburner, and produces an equally substantial level of thrust, although its cooling requirements may be a bit much for some ships.
Engines.name: Large Afterburner Module

Engines.description: The Model 512 is effectively a perfect ring of turrets, meaning positioning is far more important than the ship's exact orientation. This modified Korath engine system was designed solely for the largest Mereti warships, allowing even the heaviest vessel to carefully position itself as needed.
Engines.name: Positioner (Cluster Class)

Engines.description: Adaptive Engines are a newly developed, modular engine technology first fielded by the Bunrodea only a few decades ago. Engines of this type aren't quite as efficient as Rift Engines of the same type, but boast an incredible level of aftermarket potential.
Engines.name: Biikala Adaptive Engines

Engines.description: For their larger ships, the Bunrodea developed this larger Adaptive Engine set instead of forcing captains to just install more of the smaller model. Like its smaller cousin, this engine set possesses an extreme amount of customization potential - so much, in fact, that most Bunrodean ships can't use it all.
Engines.name: Qiikata Adaptive Engines

Engines.description: This is a bog-standard thrust upgrade for the Bunrodea's Adaptive Engines. It grants roughly 10% increased thrust over a base Biikala-model engine per unit.
Engines.name: Engine Thrust Upgrade

Engines.description: This is a bog-standard steering upgrade for the Bunrodea's Adaptive Engines. It grants roughly 20% increased turning over a base Biikala-model engine per unit.
Engines.name: Engine Turn Upgrade

Engines.description: This is an experimental upgrade that adds afterburning capabilities to the Bunrodea's adaptive engines. Bunrodean Afterburners increase energy draw even further, but also mix a small amount of hyperspace fuel in to greatly improve engine power.
Engines.name: Engine Afterburn Upgrade

Engines.description: Inspired by the Deep Atomics these fusion engines were developed in secret before making a debut miniturized and inegrated with the reactor to fit on the Reisen.
Engines.name: GS20-Ak Fusion Engine

Engines.description: Improved version of the GS20-Ak fusion engine with better efficiency and greater power generation.
Engines.name: GS26-Ak-k Fusion Engine

Engines.description: Large scale version of the fusion engine developed for the Kaga class as primary engine and power source for the ship.
Engines.name: GS152-Ak Fusion Engine

Engines.description: Ultra compact maneuvring thruster developed by Espion to improve mobility of their smaller mining vessels.
Engines.name: E-XE10 Ion Maneuver Engine

Engines.description: Tyrant Plasma Thruster but facing the other way.
Engines.name: Tyrant Reverse Thruster

Engines.description:
This is the smallest of KDB's plasma thruster and have been used to move many ships for centuries.

	Ancient thruster from KDB, known for high thrust to weight ratio and great reliability. These thrusters also comes with gimbal to provide small amount of turning capability. Although outdated, it is slightly more powerful but far less efficient than the recent Delta V's engines.
Engines.name: RD-550 Plasma Thruster

Engines.description:
Medium-sized thruster from KDB.

	Ancient thruster from KDB, known for high thrust to weight ratio and great reliability. These thrusters also comes with gimbal to provide small amount of turning capability. Although outdated, it is slightly more powerful but far less efficient than the recent Delta V's engines.
Engines.name: RD-560 Plasma Thruster

Engines.description:
Large thruster from KDB that once moved ancient battleships of the Alpha War.

	Ancient thruster from KDB, known for high thrust to weight ratio and great reliability. These thrusters also comes with gimbal to provide small amount of turning capability. Although outdated, it is slightly more powerful but far less efficient than the recent Delta V's engines.
Engines.name: RD-570 Plasma Thruster

Engines.description:
Small steering system from KDB. Once commonly found among patrol and raiding crafts from the days before the Republic.

	Ancient thruster from KDB, known for high thrust to weight ratio and great reliability. Although outdated, it is slightly more powerful but far less efficient than the recent Delta V's engines.
Engines.name: RD-550 Plasma Steering

Engines.description:
Medium-sized steering system from KDB that once powered the ship of several famous captains.

	Ancient thruster from KDB, known for high thrust to weight ratio and great reliability. Although outdated, it is slightly more powerful but far less efficient than the recent Delta V's engines.
Engines.name: RD-560 Plasma Steering

Engines.description:
Large steering system from KDB which powered the warships of both side in the Alpha War.

	Ancient thruster from KDB, known for high thrust to weight ratio and great reliability. Although outdated, it is slightly more powerful but far less efficient than the recent Delta V's engines.
Engines.name: RD-570 Plasma Steering

Engines.description: A special engine unit developed by DSSE Shipbuilding for its Lynchyoseu trawler factory ship which can operate both on sea, air, and space.
Engines.name: LC-90 Adaptive Engine

Engines.description: This large complex engine is fission powered, resulting in a massive amount of energy to drive heavy ships forwards.
Engines.name: Large Fission Drive

Engines.description:
The Sheragi's first forays into space travel involved the use of fission and fusion powered thrusters similar to this afterburner, this developed the basis of all of their future engine technologies.

	The key note about the Sheragi's original Fusion Afterburners was that they resulted in the Sheragi's development of the Hyperdrive by use of the afterburner as a reaction chamber.
Engines.name: Fusion Afterburner

Engines.description: A smaller version of the Sheragi fusion drive designed for medium warships.
Engines.name: Small Fusion Drive

Engines.description: This is a basic and cheap engine for cheap planes.
Engines.name: Arion Basic Aircraft Engines

Engines.description: This is an engine used for attacker aircraft of the Arion expeditionary fleet.
Engines.name: Arion A.A Engines

Engines.description: This is an engine used for fighter aircraft of the Arion expeditionary fleet.
Engines.name: Arion F.A Engines

Engines.description: This is an engine used for interceptor aircraft of the Arion expeditionary fleet.
Engines.name: Arion I.A Engines

Engines.description: This is an engine used for bomber aircraft of the Arion expeditionary fleet.
Engines.name: Arion B.A Engines

Engines.description: This is an engine used for medium bomber aircraft of the Arion expeditionary fleet.
Engines.name: Arion M.B.A Engines

Engines.description: This is an engine used for heavy bomber aircraft of the Arion expeditionary fleet.
Engines.name: Arion H.B.A Engines

Engines.description: The Arion Medium Light Warship Atomic Engine is an engine used for lighter ships in this expedition.
Engines.name: Arion M.L.W Atomic Engines

Engines.description: The Arion Large Light Warship Atomic Engine is an engine used for lighter ships in this expedition.
Engines.name: Arion L.L.W Atomic Engines

Engines.description: The Arion Small Heavy Warship Atomic Engine is an engine used for heavy ships in this expedition that don't have much space for engines.
Engines.name: Arion S.H.W Atomic Engines

Engines.description: The Arion Medium Heavy Warship Atomic Engine is an engine used for most heavy ships in this expedition. All Arion engines don't actually have reverse thruster, instead they redirect the direction of their thrust or use a system similar to reverse thruster on some commercial planes.
Engines.name: Arion M.H.W Atomic Engines

Engines.description: The Arion Large Heavy Warship Atomic Engine is an engine used for even heavier ships in this expedition.
Engines.name: Arion L.H.W Atomic Engines

Engines.description: The Arion Huge Heavy Warship Atomic Engine is an engine used for the largest heavy ships in this expedition.
Engines.name: Arion H.H.W Atomic Engines

Engines.description: This monster will be the engine mounted on your flagship, this bad boy will make your flagship fly with the speed of an interceptor and the maneuverability of a fighter.
Engines.name: Arion Flagship Atomic Engines

Engines.description: This is a basic and cheap engine for cheap planes.
Engines.name: Arion Basic Aircraft Engines

Engines.name: Large Fission Drive

Engines.description:
THe Sheragi's first forays into space travel involved the use of fission and fusion powered thrusters similiar to this afterburner, this developed the basis of all of their future engine technologies.

	The key note about the Sheragi's original Fusion Afterburners was that they resulted in the Sheragi's development of the Hyperdrive by use of the afterburner as a reaction chamber.
Engines.name: Fusion Afterburner

Engines.description: A smaller version of the Sheragi fusion drive designed for medium warships.
Engines.name: Small Fusion Drive

Engines.description:
This older afterburner design was once a common sight in Korath space.

	Korath afterburners pump super-heated hyperspace fuel directly into a thruster's plasma stream, resulting in a phenomenal explosion that nearly melts the thruster.
Engines.name: Afterburner (Meteor Class)

Engines.description:
Efreti engineers have adapted their smallest gravitoplasma-based thrusters into this reverser.

	This Korath engine has been modified to be partially installed in a ship's weapon space, allowing it to push the ship in reverse.
Engines.name: Arkrof GP Hybrid Reverser

Engines.description:
Reversers aren't particularly popular among the Kor Efret, yet Efreti factories still produce them for a niche market.

	This Korath engine has been modified to be partially installed in a ship's weapon space, allowing it to push the ship in reverse.
Engines.name: Farves GP Hybrid Reverser

Engines.description:
Efreti reverse thrusters are just as powerful as their normal gravitoplasma thrusters.

	This Korath engine has been modified to be partially installed in a ship's weapon space, allowing it to push the ship in reverse.
Engines.name: Gaktem GP Hybrid Reverser

Engines.description:
These are the largest gravitoplasma reversers that the Efreti have to offer.

	This Korath engine has been modified to be partially installed in a ship's weapon space, allowing it to push the ship in reverse.
Engines.name: Nelmeb GP Hybrid Reverser

Engines.description: A malfunction in the steering system has reduced its effectiveness significantly.
Engines.name: Steering (Planetary Class)(Damaged)

Engines.description: Damage to the thrusters has reduced output by half.
Engines.name: Thruster (Planetary Class)(Damaged)

Engines.description:
Korath Scrappers recovered his small afterburner from the ruins of their ancestral space.

	Korath afterburners pump super-heated hyperspace fuel directly into a thruster's plasma stream, resulting in a phenomenal explosion that nearly melts the thruster.
Engines.name: Korath Afterburner

Engines.name: Kenlark-G2 Atomic Thruster

Engines.description: Erader steering.
Engines.name: Esinkan Ion Steering

Engines.description: Erader steering.
Engines.name: Ginskel Plasma Steering

Engines.description: Erader large steering
Engines.name: Kenlark-c2 Atomic Steering

Engines.description: Standard Ultaka Engine system, a combination of jumpdrive, thruster, steering, and "afterburner".
Engines.name: Kel'aku Engines

Engines.description: An engine set less powerful than Ultaka standard Kel'aku Engines but more resistant and slightly more efficient.
Engines.name: DR Drive

Engines.description: Smaller version of Ultaka's Kel'aku Engine System for fighters and other small ships within their fleet.
Engines.name: Kel'aku-Cu Engines

Engines.description: Wallagi tiny engine
Engines.name: Kal-1 Engines

Engines.description: Wallagi medium engine
Engines.name: Kal-4 Engines

Engines.description: Wallagi large engine
Engines.name: Kal-8 Engines

Engines.description: Wallagi huge engine
Engines.name: Kal-10 Engines

Engines.description: Zis engine block tuned for high output and activatable speed boost(afterburner).
Engines.name: MPa20Sb-04 Engines

Engines.description: Zis standard small engine block found on fighters and other small ships alike.
Engines.name: MPa20Gp-02 Engines

Engines.description: Zis standard engine block.
Engines.name: MPa30Gp-02 Engines

Engines.description: Zis standard large engine block.
Engines.name: MPa60Gp-02 Engines

Engines.description: Zis standard huge engine block, found on large warships.
Engines.name: MPb12Gp-02 Engines

Engines.description: These are Kroom's rugged and powerful thruster for the size.
Engines.name: Kalmo Thruster

Engines.description: Kroom thrusters are resistant against damage.
Engines.name: Karmar Thruster

Engines.description: Large Kroom thruster
Engines.name: Kompar Thruster

Engines.description: Cearilis engines have low thrust but are very efficient. The engines can be overdriven in combat for greater speed.
Engines.name: Eakis-1 Engine

Engines.description: Cearilis engines have low thrust but are very efficient. The engines can be overdriven in combat for greater speed.
Engines.name: Ealris-1 Engine

Engines.description: Smaller version of Nuru void motion system used for smaller crafts. Due to it's compact size it does not support the same modifications as standard void motion system.
Engines.name: Nuru Mini Void Motion System

Engines.description: Unlike any starship engine ever seen, these "engines" are installed at the core of the ship and yet somehow able to move the ship in any direction.
Engines.name: Nuru Void Motion System

Engines.description: Endless skirmishes among the rival Korath forces have produced a mockery of the word efficiency. Although total power output is increased considerably, the waste energy is very nearly enough to offset the advantages.
Engines.name: Vector Engine (Reality Class)

Engines.description: The Aerugite thruster is built for Adamas drones, as they need much less thrust than other ships to move quickly.
Engines.name: Adamas Aerugite Thruster

Engines.description: Amethyst Thrusters are the second smallest of the many Adamas thruster models.
Engines.name: Adamas Amethyst Thruster

Engines.description: Amethyst Steering.
Engines.name: Adamas Amethyst Steering

Engines.description: Amethyst Reverse Thrusters.
Engines.name: Amethyst Reverse Thruster

Engines.description: The Onyx Thruster is the most average, and most common, of all Adamas thrusters, being used in the Shard and Vault.
Engines.name: Adamas Onyx Thruster

Engines.description: As with its forward counterpart, Onyx Steering is the most common steering system used by the Adamas.
Engines.name: Adamas Onyx Steering

Engines.description: Onyx engines are the most common series Adamas engines, due to their average sizes.
Engines.name: Onyx Reverse Thruster

Engines.description: Ruby Thrusters are powerful, but they come at a great size cost.
Engines.name: Adamas Ruby Thruster

Engines.description: Ruby Steering is used in both the Colossus, the Adamas heavy warship, and the Vitreus, the light warship, with drastic speed differences.
Engines.name: Adamas Ruby Steering

Engines.description: The Adamas reverse thrusters are often used in the place of powerful steering engines, for speedier hyperspace jumps.
Engines.name: Ruby Reverse Thruster

Engines.description:
Surprisingly, this rusty old antique still works.

An afterburner works by dumping hyperspace fuel into your engines and igniting it, producing a large amount of thrust. This can be very useful for dodging missiles or briefly escaping from faster opponents, but you must be careful to avoid using up so much fuel that you do not have enough left for hyperspace travel.
Engines.name: Antique Afterburner

Engines.description: An afterburner works by dumping hyperspace fuel into your engines and igniting it, producing a large amount of thrust. This can be very useful for dodging missiles or briefly escaping from faster opponents, but you must be careful to avoid using up so much fuel that you do not have enough left for hyperspace travel.
Engines.name: Stellar Afterburner

Engines.description:
The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.

All Guz thrusters have integrated afterburning systems that are proportional to the actual thrust. However, their afterburners uses noticeable amounts of fuel and also generate energy discharge.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 1 Thruster

Engines.description:
The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.

All Guz thrusters have integrated afterburning systems that are proportional to the actual thrust. However, their afterburners uses noticeable amounts of fuel and also generate energy discharge.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 2 Thruster

Engines.description:
The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.

All Guz thrusters have integrated afterburning systems that are proportional to the actual thrust. However, their afterburners uses noticeable amounts of fuel and also generate energy discharge.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 3 Thruster

Engines.description:
The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.

All Guz thrusters have integrated afterburning systems that are proportional to the actual thrust. However, their afterburners uses noticeable amounts of fuel and also generate energy discharge.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 4 Thruster

Engines.description:
The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.

All Guz thrusters have integrated afterburning systems that are proportional to the actual thrust. However, their afterburners uses noticeable amounts of fuel and also generate energy discharge.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 5 Thruster

Engines.description: The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 1 Steering

Engines.description: The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 2 Steering

Engines.description: The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 3 Steering

Engines.description: The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 4 Steering

Engines.description: The Guz engines are advanced ion engines that basically uses more energy and produce more heat to have a better result.
Engines.name: Guz'Yar 5 Steering

Engines.description: Your experience as well as your scanners can't make any sense of this engine. You can't figure out how to make it work. The only thing that you know about this thing is that it needs to be powered by a lot of energy and produce a large amount of heat. It seems the Cromha Empire know how to keep things secret
Engines.name: Empire Detonator Engine Secret

Engines.description: Endless skirmishes among the rival Korath forces have produced a mockery of the word efficiency. Although total power output is increased considerably, the waste energy is very nearly enough to offset the advantages.
Engines.name: Vector Engine (Reality Class)

Engines.description:
The Remnant live in an environment where the raw materials for fuel are relatively common on the winds of the nebula. As such, their ships incorporate significant built-in ramscoop technology, and while they are reluctant to waste fuel, they aren't afraid of using it when needed. Far more important is the ability for their ships to quickly and efficiently enter or exit combat as needed. At the end of the day, it is continued life that is paramount.

	The Bellows-Class Afterburner embodies this philosophy by providing captains with a tool that allows them to make great leaps of acceleration, typically during evasive maneuvers or to catch up with a fleeing target. Due to their enormous fuel usage, only the most specialized of ships have enough fuel to use these for more than a few seconds at a time before completely running out of fuel.
Engines.name: Bellows-Class Afterburner

Engines.description: This tiny set of engines was designed specifically for craft so small that it combines both thrusters and steering into one unit.
Engines.name: Anvil-Class Engine

Engines.description: These small but powerful engines are driven by ionized gas propelled at a sizable fraction of the speed of light.
Engines.name: Crucible-Class Thruster

Engines.description: The Remnant have taken the basic ion thruster design that has been used by humanity since the dawn of spaceflight and made it significantly more powerful... but also more power-hungry.
Engines.name: Forge-Class Thruster

Engines.description: It is not unheard of for a Remnant ship's engines to draw even more power than its weapon systems: an indication, perhaps, of their preference for avoiding battle when possible.
Engines.name: Smelter-Class Thruster

Engines.description: This steering system is tiny enough to fit in even an interceptor, but the Remnant mostly use them to provide an extra bit of maneuverability for their larger ships.
Engines.name: Crucible-Class Steering

Engines.description: This unusually power-hungry steering system packs a lot of power into a relatively small space. It seems that engine technology has progressed more rapidly for the Remnant than it has for the rest of humanity.
Engines.name: Forge-Class Steering

Engines.description: It's unclear whether the Remnant's powerful engine systems are purely their own invention, or whether they are partly inspired by alien technology.
Engines.name: Smelter-Class Steering

Engines.description:
Quarg thrusters are quite powerful for their size and produce very little heat, but at the cost of consuming immense amounts of energy.

	They also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships with these engines accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect given the thrust of their engines, while also taking less impact from external forces. Purchasing this outfit requires a Quarg License.
Engines.name: Medium Graviton Thruster

Engines.description:
Quarg steering engines are as similarly impressive as their thrusters in how much energy they consume. The Quarg don't seem to be bothered by this cost though, given the unmatched strength of their reactors.

	They also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships with these engines accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect given the thrust of their engines, while also taking less impact from external forces. Purchasing this outfit requires a Quarg License.
Engines.name: Medium Graviton Steering

Engines.description: The Heliarch wanted a more efficient engine for their big ships. This is it.
Engines.name: Advanced Thrust Module

Engines.description: The Heliarch wanted more effiicent steering for their big ships, so this outfit was born.
Engines.name: Advanced Steering Module

Engines.description: These engines are intended to be the primary means of locomotion for Pug fighters and drones.
Engines.name: Pug Akcorlo Engines

Engines.description: This is a huge thruster designed by the Pug. It is not quite as powerful as a similarly sized atomic engine, but it makes up for that by being almost as energy efficient as ion engines.
Engines.name: Pug Maretar Thruster

Engines.description: This is a huge steering system designed by the Pug. It is not quite as powerful as a similarly sized atomic engine, but it makes up for that by being almost as energy efficient as ion engines.
Engines.name: Pug Maretar Steering

Engines.description: Some Pug use this afterburner to supplement their normal thrusters. Unlike regular afterburners, it consumes more energy than fuel.
Engines.name: Pug Afterburner

Engines.description: You have no idea how this works.
Engines.name: Quantum Paradox Propulsion

Engines.description: A modified afterburner that also taps into your ships batteries for additional power, providing an increased burst of speed.
Engines.name: Hybrid Afterburner

Engines.description:
The original manufacturer of this Archaic Afterburner has been long forgotten. However, it has been preserved in remarkably good condition for its age.

	An afterburner works by dumping hyperspace fuel into your engines and igniting it, producing a large amount of thrust. This can be very useful for dodging missiles or briefly escaping from faster opponents, but you must be careful to avoid using up so much fuel that you do not have enough left for hyperspace travel.
Engines.name: Archaic Afterburner

Engines.description: Designed for use in racing, this afterburner draws power from your ships batteries as well as hyperspace fuel, providing an increased burst of speed.
Engines.name: Sunracer Afterburner

Engines.description:
This motley collection of spare parts has been assembled into a Junk propulsion system. This tiny thruster is suitable for very light fighters and interceptors.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Chimera Junk Thruster

Engines.description:
Many frontier tinkerers with no formal education began their careers by cobbling together a Junk propulsion system. This thruster is intended for small ships and freighters.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Griffin Junk Thruster

Engines.description:
Considering how they're manufactured, it's a technical marvel that the various parts used to construct a Junk propulsion system are functional. This thruster is suitable for smaller capital ships.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Hippogriff Junk Thruster

Engines.description:
Finding quality propulsion systems can be difficult on some distant frontier worlds. This large thruster is a necessity on ships too heavy for smaller engines to handle.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Manticore Junk Thruster

Engines.description:
Frontier captains will resort to using Junk propulsion systems when alternative options are unavailable. This set of huge thrusters can only be installed on ships large enough to handle them.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Tarasque Junk Thruster

Engines.description:
Junk steering systems are patchwork constructs made from the salvaged parts of other engines. This tiny engine is named after a mythical creature that had a lion's head, a goat's body, and a serpent's tail.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Chimera Junk Steering

Engines.description:
Junk steering systems are patchwork constructs made from the salvaged parts of other engines. This small engine is named after a mythical creature that had the head, forepart, and wings of an eagle and the body, hind legs, and tail of a lion.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Griffin Junk Steering

Engines.description:
Junk steering systems are patchwork constructs made from the salvaged parts of other engines. This medium sized engine is named after a mythical creature that had the foreparts of a griffin and the body of a horse.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Hippogriff Junk Steering

Engines.description:
Junk steering systems are patchwork constructs made from the salvaged parts of other engines. This large engine is named after a mythical creature that had the head of a man, the body of a lion, and the tail of a scorpion.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Manticore Junk Steering

Engines.description:
Junk steering systems are patchwork constructs made from the salvaged parts of other engines. This huge engine is named after a mythical creature that had the head of a lion, the body of a turtle, the feet of a bear, and a serpent's tail.

	Junk engines are usually a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less efficient than plasma engines.
Engines.name: Tarasque Junk Steering

Engines.description: Genesis Afterburners use a small amount of fuel combined with a burst of energy from your ship's batteries to produce a large amount of thrust.
Engines.name: Genesis Afterburner

Engines.description: Genesis Engines burn a small amount of hyperspace fuel to provide turning and thrusting to their ships.
Engines.name: Genesis Engines

Engines.description: This is a compact steering and thrusting engine.
Engines.name: Engines

Engines.description: This engine was used in the Korath capital ships.
Engines.name: Korath Thruster (Large)

Engines.description: This engine was used in the Korath capital ships.
Engines.name: Korath Steering (Large)

Engines.description: This is a convincing recreation of the Fusion Drive on the Emerald Sword.
Engines.name: Fake Sheragi Drive

Engines.description: A smaller version of the Fusion Drive, the Reactor Drive still includes a hyperdrive, a reactor core, and powerful plasma engines.
Engines.name: Reactor Drive

Engines.description:
Quarg thrusters are quite powerful for their size and produce very little heat, but at the cost of consuming immense amounts of energy.

	They also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships with these engines accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect given the thrust of their engines, while also taking less impact from external forces.
Engines.name: Large Graviton Thruster

Engines.description:
Quarg thrusters are quite powerful for their size and produce very little heat, but at the cost of consuming immense amounts of energy.

	They also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships with these engines accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect given the thrust of their engines, while also taking less impact from external forces.
Engines.name: Small Graviton Thruster

Engines.description:
Quarg steering engines are as similarly impressive as their thrusters in how much energy they consume. The Quarg don't seem to be bothered by this cost though, given the unmatched strength of their reactors.

	They also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships with these engines accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect given the thrust of their engines, while also taking less impact from external forces.
Engines.name: Large Graviton Steering

Engines.description:
Quarg steering engines are as similarly impressive as their thrusters in how much energy they consume. The Quarg don't seem to be bothered by this cost though, given the unmatched strength of their reactors.

	They also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships with these engines accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect given the thrust of their engines, while also taking less impact from external forces.
Engines.name: Small Graviton Steering

Engines.description:
Quarg thrusters are quite powerful for their size and produce very little heat, but at the cost of consuming immense amounts of energy.

	They also have strange capabilities which seem to violate the laws of physics as humanity understands them. Ships with these engines accelerate faster under their own power than one would expect given the thrust of their engines, while also taking less impact from external forces.

	Because a reverse thruster must be facing forwards, it must be installed in the weapon section of your ship instead of the engine section.
Engines.name: Tiny Graviton Reverser

Engines.description: An afterburner works by dumping hyperspace fuel into your engines and igniting it, producing a large amount of thrust. This can be very useful for dodging missiles or briefly escaping from faster opponents, but you must be careful to avoid using up so much fuel that you do not have enough left for hyperspace travel.
Engines.name: Volcano Afterburner

Engines.description: The Caldera Afterburner is designed for heavy warships, allowing otherwise slow ships to gain a burst of speed to catch up to a faster target or flee from the heat of battle.
Engines.name: Caldera Afterburner

Engines.description: The Ionic Afterburner was designed by the Syndicate to compensate for the primary weakness of an ordinary afterburner: namely, that it consumes hyperspace fuel at a prodigious rate. Ionic afterburners instead use a small amount of fuel combined with a large burst of energy from your ship's batteries to achieve the same effect.
Engines.name: Ionic Afterburner

Engines.description: When designing the Barb, the Syndicate took the opportunity to integrate their smallest thruster models to create a more compact steering and thrusting engine. The result is not very useful on anything but a fighter, and is only "adequate" in that role. Still, if engine space is at a premium, this is the smallest set of engines that will still get you there (eventually).
Engines.name: X1050 Ion Engines

Engines.description:
This is the smallest thruster that you can buy, so weak that anything larger than a drone will accelerate quite slowly when using this engine. On the other hand, it is also very energy-efficient.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X1700 Ion Thruster

Engines.description:
The X2700 Ion Thruster is intended mostly for use in small, single-person or two-person ships, as well as in fighters. It is also used in larger ships, such as freighters, that have very little space for propulsion systems or energy to drive them. But these larger ships move unbearably slowly as a result.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X2700 Ion Thruster

Engines.description:
The X3700 Ion Thruster is designed for heavy freighters and small capital ships. In theory, it could be installed in smaller ships too, if they have enough engine space, to attain almost ridiculous speeds.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X3700 Ion Thruster

Engines.description:
The X4700 Ion Thruster was developed when the Republic Navy began building warships so large that the X3700 was not sufficient for them. It allows even a capital ship to move at a respectable speed.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X4700 Ion Thruster

Engines.description:
The X5700 thruster is intended for only the largest of capital ships. When the Syndicate first began producing them, these engines were considered little more than a publicity stunt, because no ship at the time was large enough to hold one.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X5700 Ion Thruster

Engines.description:
This is the smallest set of steering thrusters that you can buy, generally considered suitable only for tiny, pilotless drones. Occasionally pilots looking for some extra outfit space will try swapping out their larger steering systems for one of these, but the results are invariably disappointing.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X1200 Ion Steering

Engines.description:
The X2200 steering system is designed for fighters and other small spacecraft, as well as for use in larger ships when maneuverability is not needed.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X2200 Ion Steering

Engines.description:
The X3200 steering system is intended for small warships and freighters. It produces enough turning force to lend agility to all but the largest of human ships, and it is considerably more energy-efficient than the plasma-drive alternatives.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X3200 Ion Steering

Engines.description:
The X4200 is a powerful steering system, designed mostly for warships because quick steering is seldom a requirement in freighter design.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X4200 Ion Steering

Engines.description:
The X5200 is a steering system so large and powerful that only a handful of ships can install it. Due to its limited market, it is produced in small numbers.

	Ion engines consume less energy than plasma engines and produce less heat, but they also take up more space for the same amount of thrust.
Engines.name: X5200 Ion Steering

Engines.description:
Traditionally, ships turn around so that they can use their main thrusters for deceleration. Some ships, however, are too ungainly for such maneuvers to be convenient, or carry sensitive cargo that must not be being swung around quickly. For such ships, a reverse thruster allows them to apply thrust smoothly backwards.

	Because a reverse thruster must be facing forwards, it must be installed in the weapon section of your ship instead of the engine section.
Engines.name: X1100 Ion Reverse Thruster

Engines.description:
This is the smallest of the plasma propulsion systems produced by Delta V Corporation, suitable for very light fighters and interceptors.

	Plasma engines are a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less energy efficient and produce more heat.
Engines.name: Chipmunk Plasma Thruster

Engines.description:
This thruster is intended for small ships and for freighters. It comes in a crate decorated with a stylized cartoon of a running greyhound.

	Plasma engines are a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less energy efficient and produce more heat.
Engines.name: Greyhound Plasma Thruster

Engines.description:
Impala class thrusters produce a significant amount of force, and are suitable for smaller capital ships. But, your ship may need extra cooling systems in order to handle them.

	Plasma engines are a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less energy efficient and produce more heat.
Engines.name: Impala Plasma Thruster

Engines.description:
This engine draws enough power that a ship with anything short of a full-fledged nuclear reactor is unlikely to be able to use it, but the thrust it generates is impressive.

	Plasma engines are a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less energy efficient and produce more heat.
Engines.name: Orca Plasma Thruster

Engines.description:
The enormous crate that this thruster is sold in comes decorated with a picture of a grinning Tyrannosaurus Rex with an improbable number of teeth. Only a handful of ships are large enough to require an engine of this size... or to have the capacity for one.

	Plasma engines are a bit more powerful than ion engines of the same size, but they are less energy efficient and produce more heat.
Engines.name: Tyrant Plasma Thruster

Engines.description:
This is the smallest plasma steering system that Delta V produces. The packaging features a cartoon of what appears to be a very highly caffeinated rodent.
