	(Operating income will not be paid while this ship is parked.)
Unique.name: Lionheart Sponsorship

Unique.description: An old fashioned post card with a photo depicting Melchior on the day it was launched from the Old Port on Zug.
Unique.name: Melchior Post Card

Unique.description: Urban legends include tales of three "Skeleton Keys" that unlock a pirate treasure. Perhaps this is one of those legendary keys.
Unique.name: Skeleton Key

Unique.description:
This certificate represents ownership of one share of Syndicate preferred stock. As a preferred shareholder, you have voting power in shareholder elections.

	Shares of Syndicate preferred stock are no longer available for purchase. The last batch was issued over 200 years ago. The Syndicate still disburses dividends for existing shares owned by those fortunate enough to have them.
Unique.name: Syndicate Stock (Preferred)

Unique.description: A map of the graveyard found aboard the Omnipotence. Several systems are marked.
Unique.name: Graveyard Map

Unique.description:
A picture of an artifact found in Earth ruins discovered under the western Sahara marshes. It depicts a crowd of prehistoric humans kneeling before a figure of some importance.

	This photo is somewhat blurry, but still might be worth something to the right person...
Unique.name: Ancient Earth Pictograph

Unique.description: With the right mapping data, this ancient device can project the movement of celestial objects across the galaxy.
Unique.name: Celestial Compass

Unique.description:
A parasitic incorporeal entity from another dimension. Midnight's Lost Orphan grants its host strange unnatural powers that can bend or warp time and space.

	However, the entity feeds on negative emotions and will manipulate the mental state of anyone nearby towards taking actions that cause strife, pain, and suffering among friend and foe alike. Crew productivity and teamwork takes a severe downturn whenever the entity is allowed to exert itself. A simple task that would normally take one crew member to perform can require two or three as tense arguments and disagreements hamper efficiency.
Unique.name: Midnight's Lost Orphan

Unique.description: This star map is obsolete. Someone with the right knowledge may be able to use this data to extrapolate the current positions of these star systems.
Unique.name: Obsolete Star Map

Unique.description:
The physical embodiment of everything that makes the Reviewers who they are today.

	Unfortunately, it's not for sale.
Unique.name: Emotional Baggage

Unique.description: You're sure the cloaking device is here somewhere, but you can't see it.
Unique.name: Cloaking Device

Unique.description:
A poodle you rescued from a dubious racing complex on Freedom. She appears to have formed a strong bond with you, willing to stick by your side.

	Her history matches with Pookie's, but Pookie's owner claimed that Puny was not hers. Puny is also vastly less urine-prone; you suspect that the race organizers may have toilet-trained her.
Unique.name: Puny

Unique.description: A strange glowing stone gifted to you by the Skadenga. It lacks any power source, yet is quite cold.
Unique.name: Tear of Skade

Unique.description: A strange glowing stone gifted to you by Ildico Drifa. It hums with energy and heat.
Unique.name: Blood of Surtr

Unique.description:
A pendant made of the same crystalline rocks found on the Hai homeworld, fashioned after a Shield Beetle. A gift from Nanachi.

	It comes with a finely crafted lit shadowbox so it can be installed and displayed with pride. A trio of mounting brackets - miniatures of those used on Quantum Keystones - provide a secure anchor to keep the pendant safe.
Unique.name: Shield Beetle Pendant

Unique.description:
While these were once considered cutting-edge outfits, their lack of autonomous capabilities and economic benefit ensured they were never licensed by a manufacturer.

	Despite this, some captains commissioned these directly from their inventor, effectively replacing one of their crew members with a robotic counterpart. These captains found that androids possessed sufficient capabilities to perform most work, but lacked the capability to captain a ship or take part in boarding actions.
Unique.name: NDR-114 Android

Unique.description:
The Remnant made a significant number of these weapons during the early years of their research on the void sprites, but have not been able to make any new ones since the Archon stopped their harvests. Without a supply of new tentacles to use, the Remnant have been unable to manufacture more. While durable, they rarely last more than a decade, so even the best cared for of the old Void Rifles degraded into uselessness centuries ago. These highly effective weapons are credited with helping the Remnant safeguard their refuges from ground-based threats during their early years.

	When fired, the Void Rifle emits a beam that has a strong paralyzing effect on the nervous system. With an area of effect that penetrates walls and other solid objects, it is an incredibly effective weapon.
Unique.name: Void Rifle

Unique.description:
This is nothing more and nothing less than a cubic meter of void sprite parts. To the Remnant, this represents both a terrible occurrence and a dreadful opportunity.

	This could have been very valuable to someone who knew what they were doing, if it had been handled properly. Instead, it is worth little more than the value of the compounds contained within.
Unique.name: Void Sprite Parts

Unique.description:
A fine board for the Avgi game of Trefoil, handcrafted from rare Integral Wood and gifted to you by Speaker Wisteria. The wood is engraved and inlaid with bands of silver, while the three sets of stones are made from polished lapis, jade, and garnet, well-worn from countless games.

	You suppose the dense wood would make an adequate blunt weapon in a pinch, though it would be a shame to damage such a fine piece in something so crass as melee combat.
Unique.name: Trefoil Board

Unique.description: A purely ceremonial weapon, this sleek shortspear is made from a continuous piece of adamantine, or nanodiamond. While not particularly useful in the realities of modern ranged combat, it certainly looks impressive.
Unique.name: Lancet Adamant

Minerals.description:
This are Ayym creatures parts. This things can be sell very expensive. But since killing living creatures is a crime, in all empire space this outfit is illegal and can be fined very high. The Rebels like to kill some of this creatures to sell their parts.

But it has also a great potential in sciences...
Minerals.name: Ayym Parts

Minerals.description: Strong, lightweight, and resistant to corrosion, the far empire quatalant is one of the chief metals used for empire warships hulls. It is the Ayym Creature who produce it by eating differents metals in the Triangle region in the Far Empire Space.
Minerals.name: Quatalant

Minerals.description: Also known as Fool's Gold, Pyrite is a common component in the manufacture of photovoltaic panels. It is also used in magnetic data storage technologies and non-rechargeable batteries.
Minerals.name: Pyrite

Minerals.description: Dysprosium is never naturally found as a free element. Many industries in a spacefaring civilization have a use for it.
Minerals.name: Dysprosium

Minerals.description: Krypton is used in nuclear fusion energy research and experimental particle physics.
Minerals.name: Krypton

Minerals.description: Radon is used in some radiation cancer therapies. Ironically, due to its radioactive properties, it is also a carcinogen.
Minerals.name: Radon

Minerals.description: Xenon is the preferred propellant used by Ion Engines since it is more environmentally friendly and less corrosive than other alternatives.
Minerals.name: Xenon

Minerals.description: Deuterium is normally harvested from the cloudy atmostpheres of gas giants. However, it can also be found frozen in the icy cores of wandering comets.
Minerals.name: Deuterium

Minerals.description: This doesn't match anything in your ship's database. It could be very valuable to the right person.
Minerals.name: Unknown Element

Minerals.description: Lightweight and rust resistant, aluminum is often used for the hulls of civilian spacecraft that do not need to be able to stand up to prolonged weapons fire.
Minerals.name: Aluminum

Minerals.description: In its pure form, copper is valued mostly for its high thermal and electrical conductivity. But, it is also used in small quantities in a wide variety of alloys.
Minerals.name: Copper

Minerals.description: Useful for its high electrical conductivity and prized for its beauty and luxury status, gold can always find a well-paying market.
Minerals.name: Gold

Minerals.description: Although it is one of the most common metals, iron is also one of the most useful.
Minerals.name: Iron

Minerals.description: As one of the densest non-radioactive elements, lead has been the material of choice for bullets ever since the invention of firearms. Its other uses are limited by regulations for preventing lead poisoning.
Minerals.name: Lead

Minerals.description: One of the most abundant of the rare earth elements, neodymium is used to make strongly magnetic alloys for use in engines and generators.
Minerals.name: Neodymium

Minerals.description: As rare as gold and even more valuable, platinum has many industrial uses because it resists oxidation even when heated to high temperatures.
Minerals.name: Platinum

Minerals.description: Silicon in its pure form is used for electronics and semiconductors. It is a very common element and easy to harvest.
Minerals.name: Silicon

Minerals.description: Although not as pricey as gold, silver is used not just in jewelry but in electronics, disinfectants, and high-quality mirrors, and as a chemical catalyst.
Minerals.name: Silver

Minerals.description: Strong, lightweight, and resistant to corrosion, titanium is one of the chief metals used for starship hulls and structural members.
Minerals.name: Titanium

Minerals.description: Tungsten has many industrial uses due to its high melting point and its strength.
Minerals.name: Tungsten

Minerals.description: Uranium is best known for its use in the nuclear reactors that power large starships. Its most stable isotope U-238 is also used for ultra-strong hull plating and for armor-piercing projectiles.
Minerals.name: Uranium

Minerals.description: An extraordinarily rare crystalline formation, forged over tens of thousands of years in the molecular clouds around supernova remnants. Although less advanced species can potentially harvest it, very few civilizations other than the Quarg have developed the technology needed to incorporate yottrite in an alloy.
Minerals.name: Yottrite

Minerals.description: 'Void Orchid' is the generic term for a variety of strange, plant-like organisms that live primarily on asteroids. Due to the way they concentrate minerals from their host asteroid, they are valued both as scientific curiosities as well as for their mineral content.
Minerals.name: Void Orchid

Minerals.description: These are a collection of numerous species of voidborne fish harvested in a perhaps unconventional manner. Despite being both flash-boiled and freeze-dried, they are surprisingly appetizing, and equally nourishing.
Minerals.name: Voidfish

Minerals.description:
Wood harvested from an integral tree is exquisitely lightweight, strong, and radiation resistant - it also fetches extraordinary prices on the market for exotic goods.

	Some claim it would even be the material of choice for a wooden starship, as ridiculous as the idea would be.
Minerals.name: Integral Wood

Minerals.description:
This granule of exotic Windjammer pollen is not only replete with nutritious proteins, but also appears to contain valuable platinum group elements bound in organic molecules. This includes a collection of complex enzymes, which appear to be capable of catalyzing many difficult reactions with ease.

	Achoo!
Minerals.name: Pollen

Minerals.description: Closer to a berry than a fruit, this tart prize of a Windjammer tree is not only delicious, but is rich in nutrients. It can be refined to extract a variety of useful medicinal compounds, giving it value both as a delicacy and as a remedy.
Minerals.name: Jamfruit

Production.description:
Experimental ship-board fighter assembly machine for assembling a fighter daily from parts based on a blueprint installed on the machine which can be bought separately.

Once bought, depart and land then go to job board and record the current number of fighter. If fighters were loss the machine will produce new fighter based on blueprint to replace it upon landing. Can stack up to two Assembler.

MUST be installed on flagship to work.
Production.name: XMA03 Fighter Assembler

Production.description: Upgrade which allow factories to manufacture Remnant technologies.
Production.name: Remnant Manufactory Upgrade

Production.description: Basic parts for constructing a fighter.
Production.name: Universal Fighter Parts

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Lance fighter made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Lance Blueprint

Production.description:
Blueprint for custom fighter fighter made to E1 standard.

[Default is Torp-equipped Lance. Customize in plugin data by editing ffcustomfighter.txt]
Production.name: E1-a Custom Blueprint 1

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Dagger fighter made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Dagger Blueprint

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Finch fighter made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Finch Blueprint

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Barb fighter made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Barb Blueprint

Production.description: Blueprint for Proton Barb fighter made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Barb-P Blueprint

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Combat Drone made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Combat Drone Blueprint

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Surveillance Drone made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Surveillance Drone Blueprint

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Petrel fighter made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Petrel Blueprint

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Smew fighter made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Smew Blueprint

Production.description: Blueprint for standard Tern fighter made to E1 standard.
Production.name: E1-a Tern Blueprint

System.description: You have no idea how this works.
System.name: Quantum Paradox Inversion
